analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in the future, in the world systems of the ten directions,

original: da ltar byung ba'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: From the perspective of the buddhas of the present, he says:

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, in the present, in the world systems of the ten directions,

original: gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gdul bya med pas mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pas /
analyzed: gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gdul bya med pas mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pas /
translated: In those places where the BhagavƒÅn buddhas have demonstrated nirvƒÅ·πáa because there are no disciples in the world systems of the ten directions,

original: de dag gzhan gyis mi mthong ba ni 'das pa'i zhes bya la /
analyzed: de dag gzhan gyis mi mthong ba ni 'das pa'i zhes bya la /
translated: those who do not see them as others do are said to be ‚Äúpast.‚Äù

original: gang mngon par rdzogs par sngas rgyas pa'i don bsgrubs pa rnams myur du mngon par rdzogs par sngas rgyas par 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang mngon par rdzogs par sngas rgyas pa'i don bsgrubs pa rnams myur du mngon par rdzogs par sngas rgyas par 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is to be accomplished in the future is called ‚Äúfuture.‚ÄùüîΩThat which is present is that which is present in the world through the perception of those who are to be trained.

original: gang yang gdul bar bya ba yod pa rnams kyis mthong @104b bar byed pas bzhugs pa ni da ltar byung ba'o zhes pa ni mi dmigs pa'i yongs su bsngo ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang gdul bar bya ba yod pa rnams kyis mthong @104b bar byed pas bzhugs pa ni da ltar byung ba'o zhes pa ni mi dmigs pa'i yongs su bsngo ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second dedication without reference point.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, with regard to the phrase ‚Äúand so on,‚Äù

original: 'dir mdor bsdu na dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyi bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'dir mdor bsdu na dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyi bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba rnams kyis so //
translated: here, in brief, those who rejoice in the merit of the buddhas and so on of the three times

original: dgongs zhes pa ni yang dag par yid la byed pa la /
analyzed: dgongs zhes pa ni yang dag par yid la byed pa la /
translated: should ‚Äúcontemplate‚Äù them correctly.

original: chos de'i zhes pa ni yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos de'i zhes pa ni yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat dharma‚Äù is that which is to be dedicated.

original: chos ni zad pa med pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni yongs su bsngos ba ma yin te phyin ci ma log pas so zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni zad pa med pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni yongs su bsngos ba ma yin te phyin ci ma log pas so zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is the utterly pure reality of the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment that is inexhaustible. The dedication that is the characteristic of the realization of that is not dedication, because it is non-erroneous.

original: chos kyis chos la yongs su mi bsngo zhes pa ni chos rnams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyis chos la yongs su mi bsngo zhes pa ni chos rnams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe Dharma does not dedicate the Dharma‚Äù is because all dharmas are essenceless.

original: de ltar na yang zhes pa dang / de bzhin du yang zhes pas rnam pa gzhan gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes pa dang / de bzhin du yang zhes pas rnam pa gzhan gsungs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù and ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù indicate another aspect.

original: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa dang / 'di zhes pa la sogs pas ni nye bar bsdu ba'o zhes pa ni phyin ci log pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa dang / 'di zhes pa la sogs pas ni nye bar bsdu ba'o zhes pa ni phyin ci log pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ste gsum pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù and so forth, and ‚Äúthis‚Äù and so forth, are the summary. This is the third dedication, which is erroneous.

original: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù and so forth.

original: bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa ni bsod nams kyi las la /
analyzed: bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa ni bsod nams kyi las la /
translated: The creation of merit is the action of merit.

original: 'du shes ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: Conception is non-attachment.

original: dben pa dang zhi ba ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa dang zhi ba ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Solitude and peace are due to the emptiness of particular and general characteristics, respectively.

original: yang gal te zhes pa la sogs pas de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: yang gal te zhes pa la sogs pas de gsungs pa ni /
translated: Again, if, etc.

original: shes pa dben zhing zhi ba nyid yin pas gal te des dngos po la mngon par zhen par gyur na de'i yang dag par yongs su bsngo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa dben zhing zhi ba nyid yin pas gal te des dngos po la mngon par zhen par gyur na de'i yang dag par yongs su bsngo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If consciousness were solitary and peaceful, then it would not be a dedication of that, since it would be attached to things.üîΩThus, etc.

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o zhes pa ni dben pa'i yongs su bsngo ba gang kho na yang dag pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o zhes pa ni dben pa'i yongs su bsngo ba gang kho na yang dag pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: The dedication of solitude is the correct dedication.üîΩWhatever, etc.

original: gang yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul gyis dran pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul gyis dran pa ste /
translated: The object of the sphere of mindfulness is mindfulness.

original: ci 'dra ba nyid ces pa la sogs pas ni brtag pa ste /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba nyid ces pa la sogs pas ni brtag pa ste /
translated: What kind, etc.

original: ci 'dra ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin la /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin la /
translated: What kind is the nature of the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni rjes su yi rang ba las byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni rjes su yi rang ba las byung ba'i'o //
translated: The roots of virtue are from the arising of rejoicing.

original: gang gis yongs su bsngo ba ni sems kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis yongs su bsngo ba ni sems kyis so //
translated: By what is it dedicated? By the mind.

original: de yang ni de gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: de yang ni de gnyi ga'o //
translated: And that is both of those.

original: de'i rigs can ni de nyid kyi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i rigs can ni de nyid kyi rigs te /
translated: Belonging to its class means belonging to its type.

original: gang zhig gi spyi'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gi spyi'o //
translated: What is its generality?

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni gang de nyid kyi dpyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni gang de nyid kyi dpyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Its characteristic is what is characteristic of that.

original: de'i rigs su gtogs pa ni de'i tshogs can no //
analyzed: de'i rigs su gtogs pa ni de'i tshogs can no //
translated: Belonging to its class means having its collection.

original: de'i rang bzhin can ni de'i ngo bo nyid @105a * //üîΩdo ; / gal te gang 'dis kyang ngo //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can ni de'i ngo bo nyid @105a * // do ; / gal te gang 'dis kyang ngo //
translated: Having its nature means having its essence.

original: de 'dra ba nyid la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa na de ltar na yang dag par yongs su bsngos pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba nyid la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa na de ltar na yang dag par yongs su bsngos pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it is that, then it is not dedicated properly if one is attached to that which is not reality, such as mere similarity.

original: gang 'das pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni de las gzhan pa'i de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang 'das pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni de las gzhan pa'i de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsungs pa /
translated: By ‚Äúthat which has passed beyond, etc.‚Äù he states the conceptual thought of that which is not reality.

original: ma thob pa ni ma skyes pas so //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni ma skyes pas so //
translated: Not obtained means not arisen.

original: gnas pa mi dmigs zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa'i phyir dang / don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa mi dmigs zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa'i phyir dang / don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-apprehension of duration‚Äù is because of natural destruction, and because of ultimate emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir gsum po med pas na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum po med pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the non-existence of the three,

original: de la mtshan ma med pa ni rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma med pa ni rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äúsignlessness‚Äù is because of the absence of a cause.

original: rnam pa ni yul med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni yul med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAspect‚Äù is the absence of an object.

original: de ltar zhes pa'i zad pa nyid la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa'i zad pa nyid la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the reality of extinction, etc.

original: mtshan ma can du byed na zhes pa ni nye bar dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma can du byed na zhes pa ni nye bar dmigs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAs a sign‚Äù is the apprehension of something.

original: de ltar na yang dag par yid la byed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag par yid la byed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is not the correct mental attention.

original: de la ni min ces pa'o //
analyzed: de la ni min ces pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to that.

original: de ltar na yang ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚Äúin that way.‚Äù

original: de ltar mtshan ma med pa can du mi byed na yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan ma med pa can du mi byed na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one does not make it signless‚Äù means ‚Äúif one does not make it without a sign, etc.‚Äù

original: de ste zhes pa ni de 'dra ba nyid la sogs pa can gyi mtshan ma med pa nyid dang yul med pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: de ste zhes pa ni de 'dra ba nyid la sogs pa can gyi mtshan ma med pa nyid dang yul med pa nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the absence of a sign, etc., and the absence of an object.

original: mtshan ma zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pas dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pas dmigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSign‚Äù is the apprehension by correct knowledge.

original: sems pa ni yang dag par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni yang dag par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The mind is the correct mental attention.

original: mtshan mar mi byed pa ni mngon par zhen par mi byed pa la /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed pa ni mngon par zhen par mi byed pa la /
translated: Not making a sign is not making a conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du 'dir zhes pa la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir zhes pa la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: Similarly, here, etc. is the summary.

original: de ltar sngas rgyas kyi bsod nams kyi chu bo la gang gis ngo bo nyid kyis chos nyid 'dir dran nas /
analyzed: de ltar sngas rgyas kyi bsod nams kyi chu bo la gang gis ngo bo nyid kyis chos nyid 'dir dran nas /
translated: Thus, in the river of merit of the extensive [practice], whoever, by means of the nature of reality, recollects this,

original: rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni sngas rgyas kyi bsod nams chu bo'i rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul gyis yongs su bsngo ba lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni sngas rgyas kyi bsod nams chu bo'i rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul gyis yongs su bsngo ba lnga pa'o //
translated: and by means of rejoicing, etc. is the fifth dedication by means of the domain of recollection of the nature of the river of merit of the extensive [practice].

original: 'di ltar zhes pa ni de gnyi ga la de kho na nyid yid la byed cing mtshan mar ni mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa ni de gnyi ga la de kho na nyid yid la byed cing mtshan mar ni mi byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, etc. is the mental attention to reality of both of those, but not making a sign.

original: 'di nyid ces pa ni mdo'i bdag nyid can nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces pa ni mdo'i bdag nyid can nyid la'o //
translated: This itself is with regard to the very nature of the s≈´tra.

original: thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'o //
translated: Not having heard is with regard to the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa ni gang yongs su bsngo ba de nyid bsod nams kyi bya ba la 'jug pa ni gting dpog par zhes pa ni thabs dang bcas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa ni gang yongs su bsngo ba de nyid bsod nams kyi bya ba la 'jug pa ni gting dpog par zhes pa ni thabs dang bcas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ste drug pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is that very dedication. The engagement in the activity of merit is the ‚Äúprofound‚Äù dedication. This is the sixth dedication.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di de yi zhes pa ni gong du bshad pa gang de la'o //
analyzed: 'di de yi zhes pa ni gong du bshad pa gang de la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to what was explained above.

original: bdag gi dngos po ni lus rnams so //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po ni lus rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúMy own things‚Äù are the bodies.

original: 'du byed de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: Those compositional factors are the roots of virtue.

original: @105b 'dir yang de dag dben zhing zhi ba la ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes pa'i don dang / 'di dang bral ba nye bar thob pa rnams su dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: @105b 'dir yang de dag dben zhing zhi ba la ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes pa'i don dang / 'di dang bral ba nye bar thob pa rnams su dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, they are isolated and peaceful, and have no intrinsic reality. The meaning is that they are not perceived as being separated from this.

original: 'on kyang zhes pa ni gal te dmigs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa ni gal te dmigs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúHowever‚Äù means that even if they are not perceived, still.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ni phyin ci ma log pas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ni phyin ci ma log pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as it is‚Äù is without error.

original: 'gags pa ni lus la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni lus la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCeased‚Äù is the body, and so on.

original: mtshan mar byed pa ni gzung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar byed pa ni gzung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The sign is the object of apprehension.

original: rnam par brtags pa ni mngon par zhen par byed pas so //üîΩyang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba la yang dag pa ji lta ba ni 'gags pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes can gyi nye bar dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can 'dir dmigs pa med par bla na med pa yang dag
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa ni mngon par zhen par byed pas so // yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba la yang dag pa ji lta ba ni 'gags pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes can gyi nye bar dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can 'dir dmigs pa med par bla na med pa yang dag
translated: The conceptualization is the adherence.

original: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed pa'o //
translated: The non-suchness is the appearance of conceptualization. Suchness is the nature of the object of perception of one who has the notion of cessation, etc. Here, one dedicates to unexcelled perfect enlightenment the very absence of the object of perception.

original: de nyid de'i zhes pa ni shin tu yang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid de'i zhes pa ni shin tu yang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That itself is his means his very.

original: de'i shin tu mtshan ma can du byed pas sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shin tu mtshan ma can du byed pas sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of application due to the sign being very much absent.

original: de yang dug dang bcas pa ni chos kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa las nyams pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'chi ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dug dang bcas pa ni chos kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa las nyams pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'chi ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is poisonous because it is the cause of death by the characteristic of falling away from the realization of reality.

original: zung rngu dang bcas pa ni 'byin dka' ba ste /
analyzed: zung rngu dang bcas pa ni 'byin dka' ba ste /
translated: It is with a dart because it is difficult to remove.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i phyir ro zhes pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ste bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i phyir ro zhes pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ste bdun pa'o //
translated: For the sake of the suffering of cyclic existence. This is the seventh dedication, which is without signs.

original: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: As it is said, For example, etc.

original: bzang po ni kha dog la sogs pa'i rab kyi mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po ni kha dog la sogs pa'i rab kyi mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: Good means the best of colors, etc.

original: de ltar yang gal te yang 'on kyang de ltar yang gzhan yang zhes pa ni tshig gi rgyan no //
analyzed: de ltar yang gal te yang 'on kyang de ltar yang gzhan yang zhes pa ni tshig gi rgyan no //
translated: Thus, although, nevertheless, still, moreover, etc. are ornamental words.

original: bsams te zhes pa ni kha dog la sogs pa la chags pas so //
analyzed: bsams te zhes pa ni kha dog la sogs pa la chags pas so //
translated: Having thought means having attachment to color, etc.

original: ro myangs pa ni ro myong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ro myangs pa ni ro myong bar byed pa ste /
translated: Having tasted means having tasted.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa'o //
translated: Having enjoyed means having fully enjoyed.

original: zhu ba ni tha mar rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la'o //
analyzed: zhu ba ni tha mar rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la'o //
translated: Having melted means in the end, with the result of karmic ripening.

original: log par gzung ba ni log par thos nas so //üîΩlog par rig pa ni log par brtags pas so //
analyzed: log par gzung ba ni log par thos nas so // log par rig pa ni log par brtags pas so //
translated: Misunderstood means having heard wrongly.üîΩMisunderstood means having examined wrongly.

original: log par kha ton byas pa ni log par goms par byas pas so //
analyzed: log par kha ton byas pa ni log par goms par byas pas so //
translated: Mislearned means having practiced wrongly.

original: legs par gsungs pa ni sngas rgyas kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa ni sngas rgyas kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: Well-spoken means spoken by the Buddha.

original: dug dang bcas pa ni don med par byed pa la zhen pas 'dir nyid la /
analyzed: dug dang bcas pa ni don med par byed pa la zhen pas 'dir nyid la /
translated: The one with poison is the one who is attached to uselessness.

original: 'di zhes pa la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: Here, the response is ‚Äúthis‚Äù and so forth.

original: skur pa ni smod pa ste /
analyzed: skur pa ni smod pa ste /
translated: The one who is disparaging is the one who is contemptuous.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par smra ba des smod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par smra ba des smod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, he is contemptuous of the one who speaks falsely.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis mkhyen pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba @106a * //üîΩdang rjes dag gi gnas skabs su rgyas pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis mkhyen pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba @106a * // dang rjes dag gi gnas skabs su rgyas pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa la /
translated: The one who is known by the wisdom of the Buddha and seen by the eye of the Buddha is the one who is completely perfected.üîΩThe one who is completely perfected is the one who is completely perfected in the state of the application of the subsequent state of perfection.

original: dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su yang dag par rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba ste brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su yang dag par rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba ste brgyad pa'o //
translated: Because he is completely engaged in the state of the main practice. This is the dedication that is approved by the Buddha, the eighth.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the one who is dedicated to the perfection of wisdom, and so forth,

original: tshul khrims zhes pa la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po las ma gtogs pa ni mtha' yas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes pa la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po las ma gtogs pa ni mtha' yas par gyur pa ste /
translated: the one who is dedicated to the perfection of morality, and so forth, is the one who is dedicated to the perfection of the aggregates of morality, and so forth, of the Tathagata, who is not excluded from the infinite.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni stong pa nyid dang ro gcig ces pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni stong pa nyid dang ro gcig ces pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The aggregates of morality and so forth are of one taste with emptiness.

original: yongs su bsngo ba ni yongs su sngo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba ni yongs su sngo bar byed pa'o //
translated: The dedication is the one who dedicates.

original: chos ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi'o //
analyzed: chos ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi'o //
translated: The Dharma is that of the perfect Buddha.

original: chud ma zos pa ni ma nyams pa la ma gtogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: chud ma zos pa ni ma nyams pa la ma gtogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: The undiminished is the dedication approved by the Buddha.

original: gang yang chos kyi dbyings su bsngo ba nyid dang / mnyam pa nyid bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang chos kyi dbyings su bsngo ba nyid dang / mnyam pa nyid bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Also, the dedication to the realm of phenomena and the teaching of equality is stated in order to desire.

original: de la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In that regard, it is stated in the verse beginning with ‚Äútherein.‚Äù

original: gang zhig 'dir zhes pa yang dag par yongs su bsngos zhes pa dang 'brel la /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir zhes pa yang dag par yongs su bsngos zhes pa dang 'brel la /
translated: Therein is connected with ‚Äúthat which is dedicated here.‚Äù

original: 'dis zhes pa ni bshad ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis zhes pa ni bshad ma thag pa ste /
translated: This refers to what was just explained.

original: ma gtogs par yongs su bsngos pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis gnang bar yongs su bsngos pas so //
analyzed: ma gtogs par yongs su bsngos pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis gnang bar yongs su bsngos pas so //
translated: The dedication is not excluded from the dedication approved by the Buddha.

original: de ltar na zhes pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o zhes pa ni ma gtogs pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ste dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o zhes pa ni ma gtogs pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ste dgu pa'o //
translated: Thus is a summary. Except is the ninth dedication, the dedication of exclusion.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then again, etc.

original: gang zhes pa ni ma gtogs pa kun tu bshad la /
analyzed: gang zhes pa ni ma gtogs pa kun tu bshad la /
translated: Whatever is the dedication of all that is excluded.

original: 'di ni zhes pa nas yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar gyis ni sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa nas yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar gyis ni sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the dedication approved by the Buddhas, from this up to dedication.

original: 'di ni zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings su yongs su bsngo ba 'di dag gis so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings su yongs su bsngo ba 'di dag gis so //
translated: This is the dedication to the realm of phenomena. By these is the dedication to the realm of phenomena.

original: mchog la sogs pa nyid ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu gcig pa'i rab tu mthar 'gro ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog la sogs pa nyid ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu gcig pa'i rab tu mthar 'gro ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: The supremacy, etc., is because of being the cause for going to the end of the eleven stages such as the Joyous, etc.

original: 'di bshad pa'i bsod nams chen po 'byung ba la gang dad pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can ni khyad par gyi rgyu'o zhes pa ni bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i yongs su bsngo ba chung ngu ste bcu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di bshad pa'i bsod nams chen po 'byung ba la gang dad pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can ni khyad par gyi rgyu'o zhes pa ni bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i yongs su bsngo ba chung ngu ste bcu pa'o //
translated: The cause of distinction is the prior presence of faith, etc. in the great merit that arises from this explanation. This is the small dedication of the great merit that arises.

original: zhog ces pa la sogs pas 'dir bshad pa'i bla lhag pa'i bsod nams la dad pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba ni khyad par gyi rgyu'o zhes pa ni bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i 'bring gi yongs su bsngo ba @106b ste bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: zhog ces pa la sogs pas 'dir bshad pa'i bla lhag pa'i bsod nams la dad pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba ni khyad par gyi rgyu'o zhes pa ni bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i 'bring gi yongs su bsngo ba @106b ste bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: The cause of distinction is the prior presence of faith, etc. in the greater merit that arises from this explanation. This is the middling dedication of the great merit that arises.

original: zhog ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhog ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The words place, etc.

original: gang yang rab 'byor zhes pa la sogs pas ni bstan pa la /
analyzed: gang yang rab 'byor zhes pa la sogs pas ni bstan pa la /
translated: The words Subhuti, etc. indicate the teaching.

original: lhag ma sbyin par byed ces pa'i bar gyis ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma sbyin par byed ces pa'i bar gyis ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The words the remainder, etc. indicate the explanation.

original: 'di rnams kyis zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: The words these, etc. refer to what follows.

original: na ba ni nad pa la /
analyzed: na ba ni nad pa la /
translated: The words the sick, etc. indicate the sick person.

original: de'i rkyen ni ched du sman no //
analyzed: de'i rkyen ni ched du sman no //
translated: The words the conditions, etc. indicate the medicine for that.

original: yo byad ni yongs su gding ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad ni yongs su gding ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The equipment is the complete giving up of the requisites, etc.

original: bde bar sbyar ba ni rgyu bde ba'i rgyu la de rnams stobs rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bde bar sbyar ba ni rgyu bde ba'i rgyu la de rnams stobs rnams kyis so //
translated: The application to happiness is the cause of the happy cause, by means of the powers.

original: bde ba la reg pa ni bde ba nyams su myong ba des gang gnas pa ste 'chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la reg pa ni bde ba nyams su myong ba des gang gnas pa ste 'chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The contact with happiness is the abiding in that experience of happiness, in the creation, etc.

original: re res zhes pa ni yongs su brtags pa bzung ba ste /
analyzed: re res zhes pa ni yongs su brtags pa bzung ba ste /
translated: Each one is to be taken as a hypothetical case.

original: rim gro bya ba nyid du so sor gnas par byas la /
analyzed: rim gro bya ba nyid du so sor gnas par byas la /
translated: They are to be placed in the service,

original: de rnams la yang byang chub sems dpa' rim gror byed pa po'i re rer yongs su brtags par byas la so sor gnas par byed pas so //
analyzed: de rnams la yang byang chub sems dpa' rim gror byed pa po'i re rer yongs su brtags par byas la so sor gnas par byed pas so //
translated: and each one of them is to be taken as a hypothetical case of the Bodhisattva who is the server.

original: rim gror gnas pa gang la zhe na /
analyzed: rim gror gnas pa gang la zhe na /
translated: In what service are they to be placed?

original: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sems can de rnams thams cad la'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sems can de rnams thams cad la'o //
translated: In the service of all those beings, because of their nature.

original: sbyin par byed pa ni sems can de rnams kyi'o //üîΩde ni 'dir dus ring du bsags pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa ni sems can de rnams kyi'o // de ni 'dir dus ring du bsags pa'o //
translated: The giving is theirs, the beings.üîΩIt is accumulated for a long time here.

original: de'i gzhi la ni dus ring du bsags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi la ni dus ring du bsags pa'o //
translated: The basis is the accumulation for a long time.

original: de ltar rgya chen po kun tu sdud pa de srid du rgya chen po skyed par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩzhog ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rgya chen po kun tu sdud pa de srid du rgya chen po skyed par 'gyur ba'o // zhog ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, to the extent that one embraces the vast, one generates the vast.üîΩThe twelfth is the dedication of the great, which is the great generation of merit.üîΩAs for the great, it is the great bodhisattvas who have been bodhisattvas for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river.

original: sngon gyi ji srid du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i rim gro ba so sor gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams kyis de la de srid du rim groüîΩbyed la / sems can rnams kyis de la de srid du rim gror bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni so so'i gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi'o zhes pa'i khyad par ni de ltar bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i chen po'i yongs su
analyzed: sngon gyi ji srid du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i rim gro ba so sor gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams kyis de la de srid du rim gro byed la / sems can rnams kyis de la de srid du rim gror bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni so so'i gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi'o zhes pa'i khyad par ni de ltar bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i chen po'i yongs su
translated: The great object is the great field, the buddhas and bodhisattvas.üîΩThe great basis is the great faith, the faith of the three doors.üîΩThe great reliance is the great reliance on the three jewels.üîΩThe great worship is the great worship of the three jewels.üîΩThe great service is the great service to the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: bsngo ba ste bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba ste bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The great dedication is the great dedication of the great merit that arises from the great field.

original: chos mchog 'bring gi bye brag gi rjes su yi rang yid la byed pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: chos mchog 'bring gi bye brag gi rjes su yi rang yid la byed pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise declares, from the perspective of the mental contemplation of rejoicing that is a specific type of middling supreme dharma:üîΩRejoicing in the roots of virtue

original: thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis //üîΩdge ba'i rtsa la yi rang ba //üîΩrjes su yi rang yid byed pa //
analyzed: thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis // dge ba'i rtsa la yi rang ba // rjes su yi rang yid byed pa //
translated: through method and nonobjectificationüîΩis declared here

original: bsgom pa yin par 'dir brjod do //üîΩzhes te de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa yin par 'dir brjod do // zhes te de gsungs pa ni /
translated: to be the meditation of mental contemplation of rejoicing.

original: de nas yang tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The passage that begins with ‚ÄúThen the venerable‚Äù and so on explains this.

original: ma lus pa ni ma lus par byas pa'o //üîΩmchog la sogs pa bcu bzhi ni mchog nyid de phyogs @107a * //
analyzed: ma lus pa ni ma lus par byas pa'o // mchog la sogs pa bcu bzhi ni mchog nyid de phyogs @107a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout exception‚Äù means without remainder.

original: bcu dang / dbus dang / dus gsum gyi dge ba la dmigs pa nyid dang rnam pa bcu bzhi yin no //
analyzed: bcu dang / dbus dang / dus gsum gyi dge ba la dmigs pa nyid dang rnam pa bcu bzhi yin no //
translated: The fourteen such as supreme are the fourteen aspects that focus on virtue in the ten directions, the center, and the three times.

original: tshig bcu gsum yod pa rnams kyis ni phyogs bcu dang dus gsum du phye bas rnam pa bcu gsum nyid do //
analyzed: tshig bcu gsum yod pa rnams kyis ni phyogs bcu dang dus gsum du phye bas rnam pa bcu gsum nyid do //
translated: The thirteen terms that exist refer to the thirteen aspects that are divided into the ten directions and the three times.

original: de la dbus kyi phra mo'i dbang du byas nas phyogs kyi rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de la dbus kyi phra mo'i dbang du byas nas phyogs kyi rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The center is posited as a direction from the perspective of the subtle.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi phyogs gcig la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi phyogs gcig la /
translated: In one part of the world system.

original: yang 'jig rten gyi khams zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'jig rten gyi khams zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is also called a world system.

original: rjes su yi rang ba ni byed pa'i dad pa shin tu gzengs bstod cing rang nyid kyis de thams cad bsgrub pa'i bsam pa shin tu yang byed pas so //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba ni byed pa'i dad pa shin tu gzengs bstod cing rang nyid kyis de thams cad bsgrub pa'i bsam pa shin tu yang byed pas so //
translated: Rejoicing is the faith of delight, which is the most excellent, and the intention to accomplish all of that oneself.

original: mi 'dzin pa ni gzung bar bya bar mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa ni gzung bar bya bar mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not grasping is the non-appearance of the object to be grasped.

original: rlom sems su mi byed pa ni dngos po nyid mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rlom sems su mi byed pa ni dngos po nyid mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Not conceiving is the non-apprehension of the entity itself,

original: rang gi ngo bos mi snang ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos mi snang ba'i phyir la /
translated: because it does not appear by its own nature.

original: mi rtog pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: Non-imagination is in terms of the general characteristic.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyis la /üîΩmi mthong ba ni lta ba la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyis la / mi mthong ba ni lta ba la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-discrimination is in terms of the specific characteristic.üîΩNot seeing is the absence of attachment to views.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni yod par mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni yod par mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Not seeing as real is the absence of attachment to existence.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtogs pas yongs su brtags pas rnam par skyed pa rnams kyis kun tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtogs pas yongs su brtags pas rnam par skyed pa rnams kyis kun tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are seen by those who are produced by the imagination of what is unreal.

original: ma skyes pa ni sa bon med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni sa bon med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Unborn means without seed.

original: nges par ma skyes pa ni ma grub pa'o //üîΩ'ong ba med pa ni ma 'ongs ba'i dus med pa la /
analyzed: nges par ma skyes pa ni ma grub pa'o // 'ong ba med pa ni ma 'ongs ba'i dus med pa la /
translated: Not definitely born means not established.üîΩWithout coming means without a future time.

original: 'gro ba med pa ni 'das pa'i dus so //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa ni 'das pa'i dus so //
translated: Without going means without a past time.

original: de ltar ji srid du 'gag par yang mi 'gyur zhes pa'i bar ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: de ltar ji srid du 'gag par yang mi 'gyur zhes pa'i bar ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i gtan tshigs te /
translated: Thus, up to not ceasing means because of the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: The reason is because of the emptiness of the intrinsic identity of things.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i skabs su yang de ltar rjes su yi rang bar bya ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas ni nges par yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i skabs su yang de ltar rjes su yi rang bar bya ba de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas ni nges par yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the section on rejoicing, the phrase ‚Äúone should rejoice thus‚Äù and ‚Äúone should make a vow thus‚Äù indicate that one should definitely rejoice and definitely make a vow.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam pa las skyes pa'i rjes su yi rang ba po nyid kyi sems ni rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes brjod do zhes pa ni mi dmigs pa'i rjes su yi rang ba ste dang po'oüîΩ// gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam pa las skyes pa'i rjes su yi rang ba po nyid kyi sems ni rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes brjod do zhes pa ni mi dmigs pa'i rjes su yi rang ba ste dang po'o // gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mind of the one who is rejoicing, which is produced from the aspect of rejoicing, is called the meritorious entity endowed with rejoicing. This is the first kind of rejoicing, which is nonapprehending.üîΩMoreover, the bodhisattva who is endowed with the perfection of wisdom, who is free from the stain of faults, who is liberated from the bonds of existence, who is unattached, who is unbound, and who is not liberated rejoices in the merit of all sentient beings.

original: rnam par grol ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Liberation is nirvana.

original: de yang chos kyi dbyings sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa nyid kyi don dam pa de nyid bzhin don dam par rang bzhin gyis @107b yongs su dag pa'i spros pa med pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi dbyings sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa nyid kyi don dam pa de nyid bzhin don dam par rang bzhin gyis @107b yongs su dag pa'i spros pa med pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, it is the ultimate reality, the dharmadhatu, which is the purification of all obscurations. It is the ultimate reality, just as it is. It is all generosity and so forth, which are free from the elaborations of natural purity.

original: chags pa ni srid pa la de med pa ni chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni srid pa la de med pa ni chags pa med pa'o //
translated: Attachment is existence. Its absence is nonattachment.

original: srid pa'i rgyu can gyi skye ba med pas ni ma bcings pa la /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyu can gyi skye ba med pas ni ma bcings pa la /
translated: Since there is no birth that is caused by existence, there is no bondage.

original: de la ma grol ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de la ma grol ba rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who are not liberated from that are liberated by the perfection of wisdom.

original: yongs su bsngo ba med pa'i tshul gyis zhes pa ni de yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba med pa'i tshul gyis zhes pa ni de yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the method of non-dedication, because that also is not perceived.

original: de ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mi 'pho ba'i ste /
analyzed: mi 'pho ba'i ste /
translated: By non-transference,

original: gnas gzhan du 'pho ba med pa yongs su bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: gnas gzhan du 'pho ba med pa yongs su bsngo ba ste /
translated: dedication is not transference to another location.

original: snga ma 'jig pas sam gzhan skyes pas ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma 'jig pas sam gzhan skyes pas ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not by the destruction of the former or by the arising of another,

original: chos kyi dbyings las gnas gzhan du 'pho ba dang 'jig pa med pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las gnas gzhan du 'pho ba dang 'jig pa med pas so //
translated: because there is no transference or destruction of the dharma-dhƒÅtu to another location.

original: yang dag par len pa ni yang dag pa'i bla ma la ste /
analyzed: yang dag par len pa ni yang dag pa'i bla ma la ste /
translated: Correct taking is from a correct guru,

original: dus mtshams dang bcas pa yang dag par blangs pa'o //
analyzed: dus mtshams dang bcas pa yang dag par blangs pa'o //
translated: with the time, it is correct taking.

original: khros pa ni smod pa dor ba la rdeg pa ni gdung ba'o //
analyzed: khros pa ni smod pa dor ba la rdeg pa ni gdung ba'o //
translated: Anger is the casting off of blame.

original: spyos pa ni skyon du gyur pa dang ma gyur pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: spyos pa ni skyon du gyur pa dang ma gyur pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Reproach is by faults, whether they have occurred or not.

original: nga rgyal dang bcas pa ni yod pa las /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang bcas pa ni yod pa las /
translated: With pride, from existence.

original: thabs ni rnam par grol ba dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: thabs ni rnam par grol ba dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The method is like liberation.üîΩBy that, rejoicing is non-apprehension.

original: des 'di rjes su yi rang ba ni mi dmigs pas so zhes pa ni thabs kyi rjes su yi rang ba ste /
analyzed: des 'di rjes su yi rang ba ni mi dmigs pas so zhes pa ni thabs kyi rjes su yi rang ba ste /
translated: This is rejoicing in the method.

original: gnyis pa'o // yongs su bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba 'di rnams ni 'dun pa la sogs pa rnams la yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gnyis pa'o // yongs su bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba 'di rnams ni 'dun pa la sogs pa rnams la yod mod kyi /
translated: Although these dedications and rejoicings are present in the willings,

original: cung zhig 'dir rab dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: cung zhig 'dir rab dang bcas pas so //
translated: they are here in a special way.üîΩAlthough the Lord has elsewhere stated that rejoicing precedes the dedication,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan du rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro ba yin kyang yongs su bsngo ba ni kha cig gis bdag nyid kyi dge ba mi zad par byed par 'dod nas yongs su bsngo zhing rjes kyi sems kyis yongs su rgyas par byed pa
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan du rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro ba yin kyang yongs su bsngo ba ni kha cig gis bdag nyid kyi dge ba mi zad par byed par 'dod nas yongs su bsngo zhing rjes kyi sems kyis yongs su rgyas par byed pa
translated: some, wishing to make their virtue inexhaustible, dedicate it, and then, with a subsequent thought, rejoice in it.

original: dang / bsod nams rgyas par byed pa dang / ser sna la sogs pa'i sems kyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: dang / bsod nams rgyas par byed pa dang / ser sna la sogs pa'i sems kyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: Rejoicing in the giving, etc. of others is not held to be done with a stingy thought, etc.

original: kha cig tu ni de ltar rjes su yi rang ba byas pa de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes pas 'di dag gi rim pa ni nges pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni de ltar rjes su yi rang ba byas pa de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes pas 'di dag gi rim pa ni nges pa med pa nyid do //
translated: In some places, the order is reversed: ‚ÄúHaving thus rejoiced, one should thus dedicate.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir na mthar rjes su yi rang ba'am yongs su bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na mthar rjes su yi rang ba'am yongs su bsngo ba ste /
translated: Therefore, in conclusion, there is rejoicing or dedication.

original: de'i de dag brjod pa'i le'u ni rjes su yi rang ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i le'u ste drug pa'o /
analyzed: de'i de dag brjod pa'i le'u ni rjes su yi rang ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i le'u ste drug pa'o /
translated: The chapter that explains those is the chapter on rejoicing and dedication, the sixth.üîΩThe supramundane path of meditation is explained in two parts:

original: // /'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi sgrub pa dang shin tu dag pa zhes pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /üîΩde la lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga @108a * //
analyzed: // /'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi sgrub pa dang shin tu dag pa zhes pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te / de la lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga @108a * //
translated: accomplishment and complete purity.üîΩTherein, the six innate afflictions are desire, anger, pride, ignorance,

original: rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba drug ste /
analyzed: rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba drug ste /
translated: the view of the transitory collection, and wrong view.üîΩThe sixteen afflictions are the six that are eliminated in the desire realm,üîΩwith anger excluded, and the ten that are eliminated in the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi de nyid la khong khro spangs pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bcu zhes pa'i nyon mongs pa bcu drug rab tu spong bar 'gyur ba ni bag la nyal las mngon du rgyu ba'i gnod pa can ni med de
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi de nyid la khong khro spangs pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bcu zhes pa'i nyon mongs pa bcu drug rab tu spong bar 'gyur ba ni bag la nyal las mngon du rgyu ba'i gnod pa can ni med de
translated: There is no harm from manifest afflictions arising from their latent states,

original: / sngon nyid du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / sngon nyid du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they were previously abandoned.

original: bag la nyal yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bag la nyal yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are also two kinds of latent states:

original: gnas dang / bag chags so //
analyzed: gnas dang / bag chags so //
translated: the abode and the instinct.

original: 'dir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las byung ba'i phung po la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid dang bcas par sgro btags pa nyid kyi log par lta ba las rgyu dang 'bras bu med ces pa'i skur ba 'debs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las byung ba'i phung po la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid dang bcas par sgro btags pa nyid kyi log par lta ba las rgyu dang 'bras bu med ces pa'i skur ba 'debs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the denial that there is cause and effect is not a nihilistic view that the aggregates, etc., which arise from dependent origination, are really existent.

original: chos mngon pa kun las btus par ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba bshad de /
analyzed: chos mngon pa kun las btus par ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba bshad de /
translated: In the Abhidharmasamuccaya, the view of the two extremes is explained,

original: 'di yang log par lta ba'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang log par lta ba'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and this is a particular kind of nihilism.

original: de la nyon mongs pa gcig cig chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis dang / chen po'i chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa gcig cig chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis dang / chen po'i chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Therein, one defilement, by the distinctions of small, medium, and great, and by the distinction of great of the great, is ninefold.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med par gtogs pa nyid kyis brgyad cu rtsa gcig la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med par gtogs pa nyid kyis brgyad cu rtsa gcig la /
translated: There are eighty-one, because of the distinctions of the realm of desire, the four meditations, and the four formless realms.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos skyon med par rtsom par bcom zhing skyon dang 'gal ba can ni bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos skyon med par rtsom par bcom zhing skyon dang 'gal ba can ni bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: The path of meditation is the antidote to afflictions that is free of error, since it is the opposite of error.

original: bsgom pa bsgom pas lam byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bsgom pa bsgom pas lam byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is the path of meditation because it is the path that is the practice of meditation.

original: shin tu ba'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtha' ni sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: shin tu ba'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtha' ni sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can te /
translated: The end of the path of meditation is the end of the path of meditation, which has the nature of the two types of generation of enlightenment mind.

original: gang yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rnams la yang chung ngu la sogs par phye bas bye brag brgyad cu rtsa gcig la /
analyzed: gang yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rnams la yang chung ngu la sogs par phye bas bye brag brgyad cu rtsa gcig la /
translated: The path of meditation is divided into eighty one types, since each of the small, medium and great stages is divided into small and so on.

original: 'dir dang po'i brgyad cu ni gnyen po'i bye brag so sor bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid can rnams te /
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i brgyad cu ni gnyen po'i bye brag so sor bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid can rnams te /
translated: Here the first eighty are the individual uninterrupted and liberated paths that are the distinct antidotes.

original: 'dir bar chad med pa nyid kyi lam du byed pa'i phyir zhes pas lam gyi rgyu yin na bar chad med pa'i lam zhes bya la /üîΩde nyid kyis nyon mongs pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'dir bar chad med pa nyid kyi lam du byed pa'i phyir zhes pas lam gyi rgyu yin na bar chad med pa'i lam zhes bya la /üîΩde nyid kyis nyon mongs pa mi skye ste /
translated: Here the uninterrupted path is the cause of the path and it is called the uninterrupted path because it is the path that is the practice of freedom from error.üîΩIt is the uninterrupted path because it is the uninterrupted path that is the cause of the path.üîΩIt is the uninterrupted path because it is the uninterrupted path that is the cause of the path.

original: rang gi skad cig la nus pa med cing mi skye ba nas rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhes pa rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi skad cig la nus pa med cing mi skye ba nas rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhes pa rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: It is called liberation because it is liberated from the power and arising of the afflictions in that moment.

original: sngon du lam gyis rtogs zhes pas lam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sngon du lam gyis rtogs zhes pas lam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called the path because it is said to realize the path previously.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam la rnam par grol ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam la rnam par grol ba'i phyir na /
translated: It is the path of liberation because it is liberation.

original: gnyen pos nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur pa'i ngo bos spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen pos nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur pa'i ngo bos spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is abandonment because it abandons the afflictions through the antidote.

original: de ltar @108b yang chos mngon pa kun las btus par gnyen po'i bye brag skyes pas nyon mongs pa skye bar mi nus shing /
analyzed: de ltar @108b yang chos mngon pa kun las btus par gnyen po'i bye brag skyes pas nyon mongs pa skye bar mi nus shing /
translated: Thus, in the Compendium of Abhidharma, the arising of the afflictions is not possible due to the arising of the specific antidote.

original: bag chags su bsgrags pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bye brag 'gags pa dus mnyam du snang ba skyes pas mun pa 'gag pa bzhin la /
analyzed: bag chags su bsgrags pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bye brag 'gags pa dus mnyam du snang ba skyes pas mun pa 'gag pa bzhin la /
translated: The specific negative tendencies called latencies are stopped simultaneously with the arising of the appearance of liberation.

original: de ltar yang 'gags pas ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gnas pa de la yang spangs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'gags pas ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gnas pa de la yang spangs so zhes bshad do //
translated: In that way, since they are stopped, the future afflictions are stopped and abide as the reality of nonarising. That is also explained as abandonment.

original: de'i dang po 'dod pa'i khams kyi rgyu mtshan ni sgrub pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo rnams kyi sems bskyed pa drug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa dgu la'o //
analyzed: de'i dang po 'dod pa'i khams kyi rgyu mtshan ni sgrub pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo rnams kyi sems bskyed pa drug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa dgu la'o //
translated: The first of these is the cause of the desire realm, which is the nature of the path of cultivation of practice, the nine stages of stainlessness and so on, which are the nature of the sixth generation of the mind of enlightenment and so on.

original: de nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bye brag bdun cu rtsa gcig ni khyad par gyi lam gyi bye brag rnam par dag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid can zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bye brag bdun cu rtsa gcig ni khyad par gyi lam gyi bye brag rnam par dag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid can zhes brjod do //
translated: Then the seventy-one distinctions of the form and formless realms are the distinctions of the path of cultivation of purification, which is the nature of the path of cultivation of complete purity, which is called the path of cultivation of complete purity.

original: sgrub pa la ltos nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa la ltos nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is completely pure in dependence on practice and because it is the cause of the seventy-second.

original: bye brag bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu shin tu ba'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni lam shes par ma bshad de /
analyzed: bye brag bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu shin tu ba'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni lam shes par ma bshad de /
translated: The seventy-second distinction is the result of the path of cultivation, the nature of complete purity, which is not explained as the path of knowledge.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par dag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par dag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be the purity of perfect buddhahood.

original: de la sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With respect to that, from the perspective of practice, the treatise states:

original: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
translated: Its essence is supreme,

original: kun la mngon par 'du mi byed //
analyzed: kun la mngon par 'du mi byed //
translated: not engaging in anything at all,

original: chos rnams dmigs pa med par ni //
analyzed: chos rnams dmigs pa med par ni //
translated: the nonobservation of phenomena,

original: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //
analyzed: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //
translated: the great purpose of being directed.

original: ces te / sgrub pa'i yan lag ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ces te / sgrub pa'i yan lag ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The branches of practice are fivefold:

original: de bsgom pa'i lam gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa po nyid la sogs pa nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar te /
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i lam gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa po nyid la sogs pa nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar te /
translated: The essence of the perfection of wisdom on the path of meditation is the completion of the wisdom of omniscience and so on up to the turning of the wheel of dharma.

original: mchog nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i chos rnams thams cad la mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: mchog nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i chos rnams thams cad la mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste /
translated: Supreme is not engaging in any phenomena that are accomplished by the six perfections.

original: nye bar dmigs pa med pas chos rnams thams cad la gtod par mi byed pa ni gtod pa la /
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa med pas chos rnams thams cad la gtod par mi byed pa ni gtod pa la /
translated: Since there is no observation of the proximate, one does not focus on any phenomena.üîΩSince one realizes that all phenomena are not observed, one attains the great purpose.

original: chos rnams thams cad la nye bar dmigs pa med pa de ltar rtogs pa thob pas don chen po nyid de 'dir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad la nye bar dmigs pa med pa de ltar rtogs pa thob pas don chen po nyid de 'dir gsungs pa ni /
translated: The great purpose is stated here:

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩ'dir bsgom pa'i lam ni gzugs la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid @109a * //
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste / 'dir bsgom pa'i lam ni gzugs la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid @109a * //
translated: Then again, etc.

original: kyi rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: kyi rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Here, the path of cultivation is the perfection of wisdom, the nature of the entity that is the unerring seeing of form, etc.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gang du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de la brjod do //
analyzed: gang du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de la brjod do //
translated: It is said to be that in which the wisdom of omniscience is perfected.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sgrib pa thams cad bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang bcas pa spangs pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sgrib pa thams cad bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang bcas pa spangs pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Omniscience is the wisdom that abandons all obscurations together with the connection of the predispositions.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang lhan cig pas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang lhan cig pas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Since it is together with the perfection of abandonment, it has the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir der bskyed pa ni snang bar byed pa'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir der bskyed pa ni snang bar byed pa'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Here, the creation of that is illumination.

original: sgrib pa'i mun pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir snang ba la /
analyzed: sgrib pa'i mun pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir snang ba la /
translated: Because all the darkness of obscuration is abandoned, there is illumination.

original: de la bgyid ces pa ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas chos thams cad so sor snang ba dang kun tu snang bar nges bgyid pa'o zhes pa ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bgyid ces pa ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas chos thams cad so sor snang ba dang kun tu snang bar nges bgyid pa'o zhes pa ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: In that, the creation is the individual illumination of all phenomena and the universal illumination through the perfection of abandonment. This is the perfection of wisdom.

original: phyag bgyi bar 'os pa'i rjes la ni bskor ba yang ngo //
analyzed: phyag bgyi bar 'os pa'i rjes la ni bskor ba yang ngo //
translated: After the one worthy of homage, there is also circumambulation.

original: 'di ni spangs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis rgyas par bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ni spangs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis rgyas par bshad de /
translated: This is explained extensively with two phrases on abandonment.

original: gos pa med pa ni sgrib pa'i dri ma thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos pa med pa ni sgrib pa'i dri ma thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Uncontaminated means that all the stains of obscuration are exhausted.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyis nye bar ma gos pa ni khams gsum pa'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyi dri ma zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyis nye bar ma gos pa ni khams gsum pa'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyi dri ma zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not contaminated by any world means that the stains of the habitual tendencies of the obscurations of the three realms are exhausted.

original: tshig gsum gyis ni ye shes rgyas par bshad de /
analyzed: tshig gsum gyis ni ye shes rgyas par bshad de /
translated: The three phrases explain wisdom extensively.

original: chos thams cad don dam par so sor snang bas snang ba ste de byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par so sor snang bas snang ba ste de byed pa'o //
translated: Illumination is the individual illumination of all phenomena ultimately, and that is its creation.

original: rab rib ni mi shes pa ste rab rib de dang bral ba ni ye shes so //
analyzed: rab rib ni mi shes pa ste rab rib de dang bral ba ni ye shes so //
translated: The eye disease is ignorance, and the absence of that eye disease is wisdom.

original: khams gsum thams cad ni gang du des don dam par khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i mun pa rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad ni gang du des don dam par khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i mun pa rnams so //
translated: The three realms are the darkness of the afflictions and views of the three realms, which are ultimately nonexistent.

original: 'di thams cad kyis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa gsungs la /
translated: All of this is said to be the perfection of one's own aim.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to the perfection of others' aims, it is said:

original: brten par bgyi ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang 'dod pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: brten par bgyi ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang 'dod pa rnams kyis so //
translated: One should rely on those who desire the state of omniscience.

original: mchog tu bgyid pa ni gnas te /
analyzed: mchog tu bgyid pa ni gnas te /
translated: One should make supreme means one should make the highest.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi thabs so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi thabs so //
translated: The means of those stream-enterers and so forth.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs ni sum cu rtsa bdun la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs ni sum cu rtsa bdun la /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment

original: de rnams kyi bde bar bgyid pa ni bgegs sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bde bar bgyid pa ni bgegs sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should make them blissful means one should remove obstacles.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes la snga nas ldongs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes la snga nas ldongs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: For those who are blind from the beginning with regard to supramundane wisdom

original: 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu spong ba dang snang ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu spong ba dang snang ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: The path of cultivation is the light of transcending the world, because it completely eliminates all fears and harms.

original: 'di rnams kyis ni theg pa @109b dman pa can gyi don gsungs nas /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni theg pa @109b dman pa can gyi don gsungs nas /
translated: Having taught the meaning of the Hinayana,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni spyan lnga zhes pa ni de yang gzhan gyi don gtso bor byed pas des de nyid bsgrub pa la dmigs pa'i dbye ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni spyan lnga zhes pa ni de yang gzhan gyi don gtso bor byed pas des de nyid bsgrub pa la dmigs pa'i dbye ba ste /
translated: he teaches the meaning of the bodhisattvas, beginning with the five eyes.

original: lnga ni sha dang / lha dang / shes rab dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos kyi spyan rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: lnga ni sha dang / lha dang / shes rab dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos kyi spyan rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The five eyes are surrounded by the eyes of flesh, gods, wisdom, buddhas, and Dharma.

original: dbyer med pas spyan te /
analyzed: dbyer med pas spyan te /
translated: They are eyes because they are inseparable.

original: chos thams cad don dam par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are seen ultimately.

original: mthong ba'i 'ching ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i 'ching ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The bonds of seeing are threefold:üîΩignorance, darkness, and cataracts.

original: de la gti mug ni mi shes pa la mun pa ni mun gnag go //
analyzed: de la gti mug ni mi shes pa la mun pa ni mun gnag go //
translated: Ignorance is not knowing. Darkness is gloom.

original: rab rib ni mun pa ste /
analyzed: rab rib ni mun pa ste /
translated: Cataracts are darkness.

original: de la chung dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas gti mug rnam pa gsum zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la chung dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas gti mug rnam pa gsum zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there are three kinds of delusion, distinguished as lesser, middling, and greater.

original: de rnams rnam par 'joms par byed de /
analyzed: de rnams rnam par 'joms par byed de /
translated: He destroys them.

original: mdor bsdu na rjes kyi gnas skabs su rab rib dang bral bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rjes kyi gnas skabs su rab rib dang bral bar byed pa ste /
translated: In brief, he makes one free from the cataract of the subsequent state.

original: rab rib ni spyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab rib ni spyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cataract is a general term.

original: chos thams cad ni phung po lnga la de mi byed pa ni don dam par na ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de rnams de bzhin nyid dang de rnams ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyis bdag nyid can pas mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phung po lnga la de mi byed pa ni don dam par na ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de rnams de bzhin nyid dang de rnams ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyis bdag nyid can pas mi byed pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are the five aggregates. He does not make them, because ultimately they are essenceless. He does not make them, because they are by nature empty of essence.

original: de'i thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are without beginning or end.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes byed do zhe na ni ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes byed do zhe na ni ste /
translated: If you say that he makes correct knowledge,

original: ma rig pa'i bag chags la sogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa nyid kyis yang dag pa'i ye shes su grub pa yang don dam par rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag chags la sogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa nyid kyis yang dag pa'i ye shes su grub pa yang don dam par rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: correct knowledge is established as having the nature of being associated with the predispositions of ignorance, etc. But ultimately it is free from intrinsic reality.

original: de ltar ci byed ce na /
analyzed: de ltar ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of that?

original: lam log pa ni chos rnams las rnam par rtog pa la //
analyzed: lam log pa ni chos rnams las rnam par rtog pa la //
translated: The path of error is the discrimination of things.

original: der ltung ba rnams la lam ste /
analyzed: der ltung ba rnams la lam ste /
translated: The path is for those who have fallen into that.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes la gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes la gzhug pa'o //
translated: It is the introduction to the wisdom of the selflessness of things.

original: gang gi lam la zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi lam la zhe na /
translated: On whose path?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i la'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i la'o //
translated: On the path to omniscience.

original: gang zhig bshad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa de ni gzhan gyi don du yang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang zhig bshad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa de ni gzhan gyi don du yang gsungs pa ni /
translated: That omniscience which is explained is also stated for the benefit of others:

original: thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba rab tu spangs pa de'i de 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba rab tu spangs pa de'i de 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: Because of the complete abandonment of the connection with residual impressions, that is the meaning of ‚Äúomniscience‚Äù here.

original: skye ba med pa can ni rnam par byang ba rnams la 'gag pa med pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: skye ba med pa can ni rnam par byang ba rnams la 'gag pa med pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rnams so //
translated: The ‚Äúnon-arising‚Äù is the non-cessation of the purifiers, the non-affliction of the afflictions.

original: gang yang seng ge bzang pos snang bar byed pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams go rims ji bzhin du drod la sogs pa bzhi dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug rnams kyi dang / bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa rnams su don dam par gzhag @110a * //
analyzed: gang yang seng ge bzang pos snang bar byed pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams go rims ji bzhin du drod la sogs pa bzhi dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug rnams kyi dang / bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa rnams su don dam par gzhag @110a * //
translated: Also, Haribhadra explains that the words ‚Äúilluminator‚Äù and so on are respectively the four such as heat, the sixteen moments of the path of seeing and the contaminated path of meditation.

original: pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical to posit them as ultimate because

original: sgrub pa'i bsgom pa'i lam zag pa med par gsungs te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i bsgom pa'i lam zag pa med par gsungs te /
translated: the uncontaminated path of meditation is said to be the path of cultivation.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kho na nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir bsgrub par bya ba ni drod la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su ji ltar rigs la /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kho na nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir bsgrub par bya ba ni drod la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su ji ltar rigs la /
translated: The very essence of that is the perfection of wisdom to be cultivated on the occasion of heat and so on.

original: gang yang bshad pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la rang gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas khams gsum thams cad kyi rab rib dang bral bar byed ces pa ni de ni shin tu yang ngo mtshar bar
analyzed: gang yang bshad pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la rang gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas khams gsum thams cad kyi rab rib dang bral bar byed ces pa ni de ni shin tu yang ngo mtshar bar
translated: Also, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering abandons afflictions of the three realms to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: byed pa ste /üîΩsdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs sa spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: byed pa ste / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs sa spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: This is very amazing.üîΩThe former masters have established that the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering abandons the afflictions of the desire realm and the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering abandons the afflictions of the two higher realms.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa nyid kyis so zhes pa'i sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis bsgrubs pa 'di dang yang ji ltar mi 'gal la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa nyid kyis so zhes pa'i sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis bsgrubs pa 'di dang yang ji ltar mi 'gal la /
translated: How is this not contradictory to the above explanation?

original: de bzhin du snga ma dang phyi mar bcom ldan 'das ma'i gsung rab la rnam par bshad pa'i tshul nyes pa mang po rnams ni gzhung mangs kyis dogs pas bdag cag gis ma spros te /
analyzed: de bzhin du snga ma dang phyi mar bcom ldan 'das ma'i gsung rab la rnam par bshad pa'i tshul nyes pa mang po rnams ni gzhung mangs kyis dogs pas bdag cag gis ma spros te /
translated: Similarly, we have not elaborated on the many faults of the explanations in the scriptures of the earlier and later masters because we fear too many words.

original: legs par shes pa rnams kyis ni rnam par shes par byas la rang nyid kyis 'dor ba nyid do //
analyzed: legs par shes pa rnams kyis ni rnam par shes par byas la rang nyid kyis 'dor ba nyid do //
translated: Those who understand well should understand this and abandon it themselves.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa ni don dam par stong pa nyid kyis ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir na gong du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa ni don dam par stong pa nyid kyis ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir na gong du gsungs pa ste /
translated: That which is unborn and unceasing is, in the ultimate, empty of essence, because it is devoid of nature, as stated above.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces pas so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces pas so //
translated: This is because of the statement, ‚ÄúThe emptiness of intrinsic identity.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la ni skyed pa po la sogs par 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la ni skyed pa po la sogs par 'gal ba med de /
translated: However, there is no contradiction in saying that the relative nature, the dependently arisen phenomena, are the creators, etc., of mundane and transcendent states.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: yum zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yum zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Mother, etc.

original: yum ni skyed pa po ste /
analyzed: yum ni skyed pa po ste /
