translated: The Mother is the creator,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nyid kyi rin po che de rnams la sbyin pa po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nyid kyi rin po che de rnams la sbyin pa po'i phyir ro //
translated: because she is the bestower of the jewels of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de las gzhan pa nyid kyi tshogs pa'i rgyu'i gnas skabs ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus la de'i sbyin pas skyed pa po'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa nyid kyi tshogs pa'i rgyu'i gnas skabs ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus la de'i sbyin pas skyed pa po'o //
translated: The state of the cause of the collection that is other than that is the producer of the body of the bodhisattvas by the giving of that.

original: sangs rgyas su gzung bas sang rgyas kyi yum du don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su gzung bas sang rgyas kyi yum du don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The mother of the buddhas should be understood by implication as the mother of the buddhas because she holds the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang @110b mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang @110b mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata are: the power of knowledge of what is possible and impossible, the power of knowledge of the results of actions, the power of knowledge of various higher and lower faculties, the power of knowledge of various elements, the power of knowledge of various dispositions, the power of knowledge of paths that lead everywhere, the power of knowledge of the recollection of former abodes, the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, the power of knowledge of the extinction of contamination, and the power of knowledge of the attainment of the state of no further learning.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam par byang ba las ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam par byang ba las ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The power of knowing the paths that lead to all the different realms, the power of knowing the absorptions, the liberations, the concentrations, the meditative attainments, the defilements, and the purification, and the power of knowing past existences.üîΩ

original: 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: the power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all destinations; the power of knowledge of superior and nonsuperior faculties; the power of knowledge of various resolves; the power of knowledge of various elements; the power of knowledge of the degree of the faculties; the power of knowledge of former existences; the power of knowledge of deaths and births; and the power of knowledge of the termination of the outflows.

original: de la srid pa dang mi srid pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la srid pa dang mi srid pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa ste /
translated: The possible and the impossible are the proper and improper.

original: de ni 'di lta ste ngan du spyod pa can rnams la mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa ni gnas yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste ngan du spyod pa can rnams la mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa ni gnas yin la /
translated: For example, for those who act badly, an undesirable ripening is proper,

original: 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin zhing /
translated: but a desirable ripening is improper.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa yang ngo //
translated: And so are karma and its ripening.üîΩThe various elements are the realms of merit, demerit, and stability,

original: khams sna tshogs pa ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs pa ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: and the superior resolve.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i las dang rab tu ldan pa'i bsod nams ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i las dang rab tu ldan pa'i bsod nams ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Merit that is associated with the karma of the form and formless realms is immovable.

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams la gnas pa rnams kyi zhe sdang dang 'dod chags la sogs pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams la gnas pa rnams kyi zhe sdang dang 'dod chags la sogs pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: Various inclinations are the delight in attachment, anger, etc. of those who abide in attachment, anger, etc.

original: dbang po ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la /
analyzed: dbang po ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la /
translated: The faculties are faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de rnams mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'i chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'i chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid de /
translated: They are lesser, middling, and greater in terms of being inferior and superior.

original: 'di ni dbang po dman pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po dman pa'o //
translated: This is an inferior faculty.

original: 'di ni 'bring ngo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bring ngo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is middling, etc.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen po'i lam ni 'di'o //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen po'i lam ni 'di'o //
translated: The path that goes everywhere is the path that is the antidote to attachment,

original: 'di ni zhe sdang gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhe sdang gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: this is the antidote to anger, etc.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum ste /
translated: The four concentrations, eight liberations, and three samƒÅdhis

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam po dang / rnam par rtog pa med cing rnam par dpyod pa med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam po dang / rnam par rtog pa med cing rnam par dpyod pa med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: with applied and sustained thought, without applied thought but with sustained thought, without applied and sustained thought, the four formless concentrations,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa can no //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa can no //
translated: the nine successive absorptions, and the afflicted and pure meditative attainments.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ro myang ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ro myang ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Among them, affliction is by means of relishing, etc.

original: rnam par byang ba ni nye bar mi dmigs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni nye bar mi dmigs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Purification is by means of nonapprehending, etc.

original: rnam par ldang ba ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas sam thod rgal gyis so //üîΩsngon gyi gnas ni sngon gyi @111a * //
analyzed: rnam par ldang ba ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas sam thod rgal gyis so // sngon gyi gnas ni sngon gyi @111a * //
translated: Emergence is by means of the lion‚Äôs sport meditative attainment or by means of skipping stages.

original: skye ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba ste /
translated: The former abode is former births.

original: de rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: de rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: To recollect that is recollection of former abodes.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dag ni sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba dang skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dag ni sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba dang skye ba'o //
translated: Death and birth are the death and birth of sentient beings.

original: zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams la /
analyzed: zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams la /
translated: The outflows are the afflictions.

original: de rnams gang de zad pa dang lam gang zhig gis zad pa de gnyi ga'i zag pa zad pa'o //üîΩgnas dang gnas ma yin pa 'di rnams la thams cad nas thams cad du yang dag pa'i shes pa de nyid stobs te /
analyzed: de rnams gang de zad pa dang lam gang zhig gis zad pa de gnyi ga'i zag pa zad pa'o // gnas dang gnas ma yin pa 'di rnams la thams cad nas thams cad du yang dag pa'i shes pa de nyid stobs te /
translated: The extinction of those and the path by which they are extinguished are the extinction of the defilements of both.

original: cig shos kyis mi thub pa'i phyir dang / de rnams zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos kyis mi thub pa'i phyir dang / de rnams zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This knowledge of all the possible and impossible is a power because it cannot be overcome by any other and because it dominates all others.

original: mi thub ces pa ni zil gyis mnan par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: mi thub ces pa ni zil gyis mnan par mi nus pa'o //
translated: It cannot be overcome means it cannot be dominated.

original: seng ge bzhin du shin tu dogs pa med cing rigs par smra ba la mi 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: seng ge bzhin du shin tu dogs pa med cing rigs par smra ba la mi 'jigs pa ste /
translated: Like a lion, he is completely fearless and speaks with certainty.

original: de'i mi 'jigs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i mi 'jigs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: His fearlessness is of four kinds:

original: mngon par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa dang bar du gcod pa'i chos la mi 'jigs pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i chos la mi 'jigs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa dang bar du gcod pa'i chos la mi 'jigs pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i chos la mi 'jigs pa rnams so //
translated: fearlessness with regard to perfect enlightenment, fearlessness with regard to the destruction of the asavas, fearlessness with regard to the obstacles, and fearlessness with regard to the path of release.

original: mngon par byang chub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Perfect enlightenment is the perfection of the knowledge of the Tathagata.

original: zag pa zad pa ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The destruction of defilements is the perfection of abandonment.

original: gnyi ga yang rang gi don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rang gi don to //
translated: Both of these are for one's own benefit.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi bgegs la /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi bgegs la /
translated: The Dharma of obstacles is the obstruction to the Dharma of nirvana.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i chos ni mya ngan 'das pa thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i chos ni mya ngan 'das pa thob par byed pa ste /
translated: The Dharma of emancipation is that which causes the attainment of nirvana.

original: de gnyi ga la yang gzhan gyi don te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la yang gzhan gyi don te /
translated: Both of these are for the benefit of others.

original: gzhan rnams la de bshad pas de rnams la mi 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan rnams la de bshad pas de rnams la mi 'jigs pa ste /
translated: By explaining these to others, they become fearless.

original: de'i dam bcas pa rab tu gnas pa nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dam bcas pa rab tu gnas pa nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of firm in one's vow.

original: mgon med pa ni skyabs med pa ste de rnams kyi mgon dang skyabs ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: mgon med pa ni skyabs med pa ste de rnams kyi mgon dang skyabs ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Those without a protector are those without refuge. Their protector and refuge is the Bhagavan Buddha.

original: de'i bgyid pa ni 'dis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bgyid pa ni 'dis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: His activity is the perfection of omniscient wisdom.

original: rnam pa dgu zhes pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu zhes pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is endowed with the nine aspects.

original: 'di nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pas mthu dang ldan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pas mthu dang ldan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Desiring to speak about this very omniscience, he says:

original: 'khor ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Samsara and so on.

original: 'khor ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga rnams la /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga rnams la /
translated: Samsara is the five contaminated aggregates.

original: de'i gnyen po 'joms par byed pa po ni chos kyi dbyings de'i 'joms par byed pa po ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po 'joms par byed pa po ni chos kyi dbyings de'i 'joms par byed pa po ste /
translated: The antidote to that, the destroyer, is the dharmadhatu, the destroyer of that.

original: de gsungs pa ni /üîΩther zug ces pa ste /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni / ther zug ces pa ste /
translated: That is stated:

original: chos kyi dbyings ni ther zug par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni ther zug par gnas pa ste /
translated: The dharmadhatu is permanent,

original: thog ma dang tha mar ro gcig pa'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha mar ro gcig pa'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is of the same nature from beginning to end.

original: de yang gnyen por gyur na ni gdod nas de nyid pas 'khor bar @111b mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang gnyen por gyur na ni gdod nas de nyid pas 'khor bar @111b mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if it were the antidote, it would not be samsara, because it is primordial.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la thog mar blo dang ldan pas gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro bar byed pa'i lam zhes pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la thog mar blo dang ldan pas gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro bar byed pa'i lam zhes pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.

original: de nyid de'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid de'i gnyen po ste /
translated: That itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.

original: 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa gsungs la /
analyzed: 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa gsungs la /
translated: This teaches the perfection of abandonment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.üîΩThat itself is the antidote to that.üîΩThis teaches the perfection of abandonment.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa ni chos thams cad ces pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa ni chos thams cad ces pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the path that the wise one traverses higher and higher.

original: chos rnams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
translated: That itself is the antidote to that

original: de'i khyad par ni ston pa po ste /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni ston pa po ste /
translated: Its distinction is the teacher.

original: rang dang gzhan rnams la'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan rnams la'o //
translated: It is for oneself and others.

original: gzhan gyi don du ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: It is complete for the sake of others,

original: gcig gis kyang ma rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis kyang ma rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not incomplete in any way.

original: lan gsum du bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo ni chos bstan pa la de nyid 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo ni chos bstan pa la de nyid 'khor lo ste /
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is the teaching of the Dharma, which has twelve aspects and is turned three times.

original: gdul bya'i rgyud la 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya'i rgyud la 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a wheel because it is turned in the mental continua of those to be trained.

original: de'i skor ba po ni sangs rgyas rnams te /
analyzed: de'i skor ba po ni sangs rgyas rnams te /
translated: The one who turns it is the Buddha,

original: de nyid des bskor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid des bskor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he alone turns it.üîΩThe wheel of the Dharma is the four noble truths, which are turned three times.

original: de la chos kyi 'khor lo bden pa bzhi la lan gsum du bzlas pa ni 'di ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de la chos kyi 'khor lo bden pa bzhi la lan gsum du bzlas pa ni 'di ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: This is suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.üîΩThis is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes pa ni bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo'i le'u dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes pa ni bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo'i le'u dang po'o //
translated: This is the first chapter, having four noble truths as its content.

original: de nyid la go rims bzhin du yongs su shes par bya ba dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba nyid ni le'u gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la go rims bzhin du yongs su shes par bya ba dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba nyid ni le'u gnyis pa'o //
translated: The objects of knowledge, abandonment, realization, and cultivation are the second chapter.

original: de'i de nyid la bdag nyid kyis yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa dang bsgom pa nyid ni le'u gsum pa ste /
analyzed: de'i de nyid la bdag nyid kyis yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa dang bsgom pa nyid ni le'u gsum pa ste /
translated: The self-realization of the reality of those is the third chapter.

original: 'di ni rnam pa bcu gnyis so //üîΩkun rdzob tu mo gsham gyi rang gi skad cig skye ba nyid ni rgyun 'gags pa ni mes grang ba 'gags pa bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis log pa'i shes pa 'gag par 'gyur ba ni sngon nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yang
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa bcu gnyis so // kun rdzob tu mo gsham gyi rang gi skad cig skye ba nyid ni rgyun 'gags pa ni mes grang ba 'gags pa bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis log pa'i shes pa 'gag par 'gyur ba ni sngon nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yang
translated: This has twelve aspects.

original: dag pa'i shes pa de'i rgyu can des 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i shes pa de'i rgyu can des 'gags pa ste /
translated: The arising of the non-existent son of a barren woman is the cessation of the continuum, like the cessation of cold by fire. The cessation of wrong knowledge is by the perfection of wisdom itself. The cessation of that is the cause of the pure knowledge that will arise later.

original: kun rdzob tu ni ci yang med pa nyid du mi sbyor bas byang chub kyi sems nyid kyis ji ltar rigs par 'gog pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni ci yang med pa nyid du mi sbyor bas byang chub kyi sems nyid kyis ji ltar rigs par 'gog pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The essence of the path of cultivation is the knowledge of reality that is to be stopped by the very thought of enlightenment, since it is not applied to the non-existence of anything at all in the conventional.

original: mchog nyid gsungs pa ni ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mchog nyid gsungs pa ni ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement of supremacy is from ‚Äújust as‚Äù and so on.

original: gnas par bgyi ba ni gnas par byas shing mchod pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gnas par bgyi ba ni gnas par byas shing mchod pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The worship is by those who have made the worship of the abodes.

original: yid la bgyi ba ni yon tan rjes su dran pa rnams kyis so //üîΩphyag 'tshal bar bgyi @112a * //
analyzed: yid la bgyi ba ni yon tan rjes su dran pa rnams kyis so // phyag 'tshal bar bgyi @112a * //
translated: The mental attention is by those who recollect the qualities.

original: ba ni lus ngag yid gsum gyis so //
analyzed: ba ni lus ngag yid gsum gyis so //
translated: The homage is by the three, body, speech, and mind.

original: ci'i phyir 'di ni gnas skabs la 'dri ba'i rgyu ni bcom ldan 'das ma mchog nyid du'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ni gnas skabs la 'dri ba'i rgyu ni bcom ldan 'das ma mchog nyid du'o //
translated: The reason for the question about the occasion is the supremacy of the Transcendent Conqueror Lady.

original: yongs su 'dren pa med pa ni yongs su 'dren pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa med pa ni yongs su 'dren pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The absence of a guide is the lack of a guide.

original: skal ba med pa ni bskor bar mi nus pa la dmus long du gyur pa ni dmus long dang 'dra ba'o zhes pa ni mchog nyid do //
analyzed: skal ba med pa ni bskor bar mi nus pa la dmus long du gyur pa ni dmus long dang 'dra ba'o zhes pa ni mchog nyid do //
translated: The unfortunate are those who are unable to turn around. The blind are like the blind. This is the supremacy.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then again, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the path of cultivation.

original: gang zhig phung po lnga rnams kyi chos rnams thams cad ji srid du mngon par 'du mi byed cing nye bar mi dmigs pa de nyid 'di'i sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig phung po lnga rnams kyi chos rnams thams cad ji srid du mngon par 'du mi byed cing nye bar mi dmigs pa de nyid 'di'i sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Whoever does not form the five aggregates, and does not apprehend any phenomena whatsoever, that is the completion of his practice.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus have I heard, etc.

original: chos gang zhes pa ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang zhes pa ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Any phenomenon means the uncontaminated.

original: chos gang yang gtod par mi byed ces pa ni chos rnams la gtod par byed pa yang nye bar mi dmigs zhes pa'i gtod pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang yang gtod par mi byed ces pa ni chos rnams la gtod par byed pa yang nye bar mi dmigs zhes pa'i gtod pa'o //
translated: He does not cause any phenomenon to be apprehended means that he does not apprehend the apprehension of phenomena.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then again, etc.

original: ming ni 'du shes la mngon par 'du byed pa ni brtags pas so //
analyzed: ming ni 'du shes la mngon par 'du byed pa ni brtags pas so //
translated: Name is perception, and formation is imputation.

original: ji ltar gtod par mi byed ces pa ni chos rnams la gtod par mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gtod par mi byed ces pa ni chos rnams la gtod par mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How does he not cause to be apprehended? He does not cause the apprehension of phenomena because he is free from discursive thought.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pas so //
translated: Thus, because of non-conceptuality.

original: ci yang med ces pa ni chos rnams la skye ba la sogs pa rnams su yang rnam par rtog pa med pas so zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med ces pa ni chos rnams la skye ba la sogs pa rnams su yang rnam par rtog pa med pas so zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: Nothing whatsoever, because of non-conceptuality in regard to the origination, etc. of things. This is the intended meaning.

original: nye bar zhes pa ni skye ba med cing 'gag pa yang med ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar zhes pa ni skye ba med cing 'gag pa yang med ces pa'i don to //
translated: Appropriated, means non-arisen and non-ceased.

original: 'dir nye bar mi gnas pa ni cung zad byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar mi gnas pa ni cung zad byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, non-appropriated, means not doing anything at all.

original: de ltar yang zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa la gtod par byed pa po nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa la gtod par byed pa po nyid kyang ngo //
translated: Thus, means the one who is dedicated to omniscience.

original: ring du byed par 'gyur zhes pa ni mngon du byed pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: ring du byed par 'gyur zhes pa ni mngon du byed pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Far removed, means not manifest.

original: gsog tu bgyid pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsog tu bgyid pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Empty, means not having the characteristic of manifest knowledge.

original: gsob tu bgyid pa ni de'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsob tu bgyid pa ni de'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Hollow, means not having its result.

original: mi bgyid ces pa ni skye bar 'gyur bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi bgyid ces pa ni skye bar 'gyur bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not doing anything at all, means not causing origination.

original: yod pa ni 'di dag nyid kyi rnam grangs dag gi don ji lta bar khyod kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni 'di dag nyid kyi rnam grangs dag gi don ji lta bar khyod kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: The existent is just these synonyms, as they are explained by you.

original: yongs su gsal bar ma byas pa ni bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar ma byas pa ni bstan pa ste /
translated: The not fully manifested is the teaching.

original: gzugs gsal bar ma byas zhes pa nas ji srid du sangs rgyas nyid ces pa'i bar ni chos gang yang med ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs gsal bar ma byas zhes pa nas ji srid du sangs rgyas nyid ces pa'i bar ni chos gang yang med ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúno dharma whatsoever‚Äù is from ‚Äúform is not manifested‚Äù up to ‚Äúbuddhahood is not manifested.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir chos gang yang ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gang yang ma mthong ba ste /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúno dharma whatsoever is seen.‚Äù

original: @112b ring du byed ces pa la sogs pa can la /
analyzed: @112b ring du byed ces pa la sogs pa can la /
translated: ‚ÄúNot made great‚Äù and so on means

original: chen por mi bgyid ces pa la sogs pa ni chos rnams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen por mi bgyid ces pa la sogs pa ni chos rnams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äúnot made small‚Äù and so on, because all dharmas are essenceless.

original: sdud par mi byed g-yeng bar mi byed ces pa ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdud par mi byed g-yeng bar mi byed ces pa ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot collected‚Äù and ‚Äúnot scattered‚Äù means ‚Äúnot one‚Äù and ‚Äúnot many,‚Äù because of nonduality.

original: de ltar yang don chen por yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yang don chen por yang ngo //
translated: Thus, it is also ‚Äúgreat in meaning.‚Äù

original: rgyu mthun pa ni de'i rjes su gyur pa'i nges pas so //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa ni de'i rjes su gyur pa'i nges pas so //
translated: The natural outflow is by the certainty that follows from that.

original: sems can ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can la /
analyzed: sems can ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can la /
translated: A sentient being is one whose nature is the five aggregates.

original: gang zag gam rdzas kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zag gam rdzas kyang de bzhin no //
translated: A person and a substance are also like that.

original: ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: The essence is

original: mtshan nyid la skye bar ni skyed pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la skye bar ni skyed pa ste /
translated: As for the characteristic, it is the generation of what is not yet generated.

original: de dag dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: It is just the absence of those.

original: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa ni sems can ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa ni sems can ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Its extensive explanation is that sentient beings are essenceless, and so on.

original: dben pa ni stong pa nyid la bsam gyis mi khyab pas dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa ni stong pa nyid la bsam gyis mi khyab pas dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: Isolation is emptiness, which is not apprehended because it is inconceivable.

original: mngon par byang ma chub pa ni mngon sum gyi bya ba de la med pas so //
analyzed: mngon par byang ma chub pa ni mngon sum gyi bya ba de la med pas so //
translated: Non-manifest enlightenment is the absence of that activity of manifestation.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba ni yang dag pa'i don des ma bzung bas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba ni yang dag pa'i don des ma bzung bas so //
translated: Just as it is is not apprehended by that meaning of reality.

original: stobs yang dag par sgrub pa ni stobs rdzogs par byed pa cung zad med do //
analyzed: stobs yang dag par sgrub pa ni stobs rdzogs par byed pa cung zad med do //
translated: The complete accomplishment of power is the absence of any completion of power.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhes pa ni don chen po nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhes pa ni don chen po nyid do //
translated: Thus, the Tathagata in this profound perfection of wisdom is the greatness of meaning.

original: sgrub pa'i yan lag drug pa dang bdun pa la yang mos pa'i rgyu dang spong ba'i rgyu yod de /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yan lag drug pa dang bdun pa la yang mos pa'i rgyu dang spong ba'i rgyu yod de /
translated: In the sixth and seventh branches of accomplishment, there is the cause of interest and the cause of abandonment.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: In that regard, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:

original: sangs rgyas bsten dang sbyin sogs dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa //üîΩ'di la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsten dang sbyin sogs dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa // 'di la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin //
translated: Relying on the Buddha, generosity, and so forth, and skill in means.

original: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu dag ni //üîΩbdud kyi thibs kyis non pa dang // zab mo'i chos la ma mos dang // phung po la sogs mngon zhen dang // sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu dag ni // bdud kyi thibs kyis non pa dang // zab mo'i chos la ma mos dang // phung po la sogs mngon zhen dang // sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa'o //
translated: The causes of the loss of the Dharma areüîΩBeing overcome by the darkness of Mara, not being devoted to the profound Dharma,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: Being attached to the aggregates and so forth, and being seized by evil companions.

original: mos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam 'di lta ste /
translated: Devotion is the path of cultivation.

original: de gsungs pa ni de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement of that is from ‚ÄúThen, again‚Äù and so forth.

original: mos zhes pa ni nges pa'i dngos po nyid las gzhan ma yin zhes rtogs par byed cing mos par byed par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mos zhes pa ni nges pa'i dngos po nyid las gzhan ma yin zhes rtogs par byed cing mos par byed par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Devotion‚Äù is the realization that there is nothing other than the nature of the ascertained object, and it is the devotion that occurs.

original: de'i bshad pa ni mi bgyid ces pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩnem nur ni gnod pa la /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni mi bgyid ces pa la sogs pa ste / nem nur ni gnod pa la /
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúwe will not do‚Äù and so forth.üîΩDoubt is in regard to harm.

original: the tshom ni som nyi'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni som nyi'o //
translated: Hesitation is doubt.

original: rmongs pa ni sgrub pa dang mi ldan pas so //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni sgrub pa dang mi ldan pas so //
translated: Confusion is due to not possessing practice.

original: rmongs par 'gyur zhes pa ni rmongs par byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rmongs par 'gyur zhes pa ni rmongs par byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Confusion‚Äù is the confusion that occurs.

original: don dang zhes pa ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: don dang zhes pa ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad po rnams kyis so //
translated: The meaning is the eight realizations.

original: don gyi tshul zhes pa ni ji ltar rang gis sems bskyed pa dang / gdams ngag ces pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi dngos po @113a * //üîΩrnams kyis so //
analyzed: don gyi tshul zhes pa ni ji ltar rang gis sems bskyed pa dang / gdams ngag ces pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi dngos po @113a * // rnams kyis so //
translated: The way of the meaning is by the things of those, such as the generation of one‚Äôs own mind and the precepts.

original: chos nyid ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge 'di rnams kyis la /
analyzed: chos nyid ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge 'di rnams kyis la /
translated: The reality is by these names, phrases, and letters.

original: chos kyi tshul ni bsdus pa dang rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul ni bsdus pa dang rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The way of the Dharma is by the concise, extensive, and so forth.

original: rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ba ni rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ba ni rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One will understand is because of following.

original: rjes su 'tshal bar 'gyur ba ni de bzhin du shes pas so //
analyzed: rjes su 'tshal bar 'gyur ba ni de bzhin du shes pas so //
translated: One will know is because of knowing thus.

original: rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ba ni de ltar gzhan nyid do //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhes pa ni gang du rtags kyis te /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ba ni de ltar gzhan nyid do // de ci'i phyir zhes pa ni gang du rtags kyis te /
translated: One will realize is because of being thus different.üîΩWhy is that? is where the reason is.

original: rtags gsungs pa ni ji srid ces pa ste /
analyzed: rtags gsungs pa ni ji srid ces pa ste /
translated: The reason is stated: for as long as‚Ä¶

original: yun ring por spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: yun ring por spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la'o //
translated: Practicing for a long time is on the perfections.

original: tshul khrims bsrungs pa ni 'dis tshul khrims te /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs pa ni 'dis tshul khrims te /
translated: Keeping ethics is by this ethics.

original: yun ring por spyod pa can no zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bsten pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring por spyod pa can no zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bsten pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: One who practices for a long time is one who has attended to the Buddha and practiced generosity and so forth.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then and so forth.

original: nus zhes pa ni gang gis gang la'o //
analyzed: nus zhes pa ni gang gis gang la'o //
translated: The ability is that by which one is able to do something.

original: nyan par 'dod pa ni sgra la'o //
analyzed: nyan par 'dod pa ni sgra la'o //
translated: One who wishes to listen is one who is able to listen to the words.

original: rtogs pa ni don la'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni don la'o //
translated: One who realizes is one who is able to understand the meaning.

original: bsam pa ni dus gzhan du dran par ro //
analyzed: bsam pa ni dus gzhan du dran par ro //
translated: One who intends is one who is able to remember at another time.

original: bskyed pa ni bsam pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa ni bsam pa'i dus su'o //
translated: One who generates is one who is able to generate the thought at the time of intention.

original: nye bar gzung ba ni bsgom pa'i dus su sems pas brtan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gzung ba ni bsgom pa'i dus su sems pas brtan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who upholds is one who is able to stabilize the thought at the time of meditation.

original: 'di ni snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: This is illumination.

original: 'di dang 'di la zhes pa ni so sor snang bar byed pa'i rten rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di la zhes pa ni so sor snang bar byed pa'i rten rnams la'o //
translated: This and that refers to the individual bases of illumination.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa ni snang bar byed pas la /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa ni snang bar byed pas la /
translated: Thus refers to the illumination.

original: rnam pa ni mtshan nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa ni mtshan nyid kyis te /
translated: By aspects is meant by characteristics.

original: dper na ba lang gi aog shal la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi aog shal la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: For example, by the dewlap and so forth of an ox.

original: rtags kyis ni bcos mas te /
analyzed: rtags kyis ni bcos mas te /
translated: By signs is meant by artificiality.

original: dper na ba lang gi dril bu la sogs pa bzhin la /
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi dril bu la sogs pa bzhin la /
translated: For example, by the bell and so forth of an ox.

original: mtshan ma ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma ste /
translated: The sign is the sign of the nature.

original: dper na ba lang dkar po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang dkar po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the whiteness of a cow and so forth.

original: bstan pa ni gzhan la'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni gzhan la'o //
translated: The teaching is to others.

original: mnyan par byed pa ni gzhan las so //
analyzed: mnyan par byed pa ni gzhan las so //
translated: Listening is from others.

original: phung po ni phung po la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: phung po ni phung po la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The aggregates are by the aggregates and so forth.

original: chos rnams thams cad la phung po la sogs pa rnams kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ni chos thams cad dben pa nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu ni thog ma dang tha ma gnyis dang bral bas ni shin tu dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad la phung po la sogs pa rnams kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ni chos thams cad dben pa nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu ni thog ma dang tha ma gnyis dang bral bas ni shin tu dben pa nyid do //
translated: Because all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics by the aggregates and so forth, all phenomena are void. Because cause and effect are free from the two, beginning and end, they are extremely void.

original: gzhan ma med ces pa ni gzhan gang na yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan ma med ces pa ni gzhan gang na yang ngo //
translated: The absence of another is in any other place.

original: ci'i phyir na skye ba'i rgyu dang bral ba nyid kyis stong pa la rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir dben pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na skye ba'i rgyu dang bral ba nyid kyis stong pa la rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir dben pa'o //
translated: Why? Because emptiness is free from the cause of arising, it is void because it is free from its own nature.

original: 'bras bu'i nus pa dang bral bas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i nus pa dang bral bas zhi ba'o //
translated: Because it is free from the potency of the effect, it is peace.

original: de ltar na zhes pa la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes pa la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus, and so forth, is the summary.

original: gang dmigs su med pa zhes pa ni don dam par la @113b kun rdzob tu ni nye bar dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gang dmigs su med pa zhes pa ni don dam par la @113b kun rdzob tu ni nye bar dmigs pa ste /
translated: That which is not an object of observation is ultimately, and conventionally, an object of observation.

original: dmigs pa med pa tsam po ma yin zhes pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa tsam po ma yin zhes pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: That it is not just a non-object of observation is the skill in means.

original: chos kyis phongs pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang bral ba nas yun ring por ngan 'gror gnas pas des nyan pa la sogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyis phongs pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang bral ba nas yun ring por ngan 'gror gnas pas des nyan pa la sogs pa med pa ste /
translated: Deprivation of Dharma is the absence of listening, etc. , due to being separated from excellence and due to remaining in miserable realms for a long time.

original: de'i rgyu ni dam pa'i chos spong ba la de nyid ni chos kyis phongs pa dang mthun par 'gyur ba'i las te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni dam pa'i chos spong ba la de nyid ni chos kyis phongs pa dang mthun par 'gyur ba'i las te /
translated: The cause of that is the very abandonment of the excellent Dharma, which is karma that is conducive to deprivation of Dharma.

original: des rgyu'i bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rgyu'i bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it performs the function of a cause of that.

original: de'i gnas skabs ni de ltar gnas brtan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs ni de ltar gnas brtan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The situation of that is as follows: ‚ÄúThe elders, etc. ,‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa 'dir bsgom pa'i lam la'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa 'dir bsgom pa'i lam la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the perfection of wisdom‚Äù refers to the path of meditation.

original: rnal 'byor ni yang dag par len pas na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni yang dag par len pas na /
translated: ‚ÄúYoga‚Äù is the correct taking up of the path.

original: rnam par phye ste zhes pa ni kha cig ni yun ring por spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par phye ste zhes pa ni kha cig ni yun ring por spyod pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúDistinguishing‚Äù means that some have practiced for a long time,

original: kha cig ni min zhes pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni min zhes pa ste /
translated: and some have not.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi tshod kyis sna tshogs pa nyid de gsungs pa ni bsnyen bkur byed pa mi 'gyur zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi tshod kyis sna tshogs pa nyid de gsungs pa ni bsnyen bkur byed pa mi 'gyur zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The diversity of the faculties of faith, etc. is the reason.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa dang / yongs su ma dris pa ni dad pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa dang / yongs su ma dris pa ni dad pa dang bral bas so //
translated: One does not serve the Buddhas, i.e., one is not endowed with faith, if one does not ask questions.

original: byas pa ni lan cig byas pas so //
analyzed: byas pa ni lan cig byas pas so //
translated: One serves them once is to serve them only once.

original: bsags pa ni yang yang byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsags pa ni yang yang byed pa'o //
translated: One serves them repeatedly is to serve them again and again.

original: kun nas bsags pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas bsags pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: One serves them fully is to serve them completely.

original: nye bar bsags pa ni rnam par smin pa ster ba'i nus pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsags pa ni rnam par smin pa ster ba'i nus pa thob pa'o //
translated: One serves them well is to serve them in a manner that will bring about a result.

original: lus kyis tshogs pa ni nyan du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyis tshogs pa ni nyan du 'ong ba'o //
translated: One serves them with the body is to come to listen to them.

original: sems kyis ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'o //
translated: One serves them with the mind is to listen without distraction.

original: ngag gis ni skabs su bab pa mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: ngag gis ni skabs su bab pa mi smra ba'o //
translated: One serves them with speech is to ask questions at the appropriate time.

original: mi sbyin pa ni yang dag par ma nyan pa'o //
analyzed: mi sbyin pa ni yang dag par ma nyan pa'o //
translated: One does not give is to not listen properly.

original: mi shes pa ni gzhung la /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni gzhung la /
translated: One does not know is to not understand the text.

original: mi mthong ba ni don no //
analyzed: mi mthong ba ni don no //
translated: One does not see is to not understand the meaning.

original: khong du mi chud pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyis la /
analyzed: khong du mi chud pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyis la /
translated: Not understanding is with regard to the nature of the two realities.

original: rig par mi byed pa ni phyin ci log tu rtogs pas so //
analyzed: rig par mi byed pa ni phyin ci log tu rtogs pas so //
translated: Not knowing is with regard to the two realities.

original: spong bar 'gyur ba ni yid kyis btang bas so //
analyzed: spong bar 'gyur ba ni yid kyis btang bas so //
translated: Abandoning is by the mind.

original: skur ba ni ngag gis so //
analyzed: skur ba ni ngag gis so //
translated: Denying is by speech.

original: khro ba ni smod pa la /
analyzed: khro ba ni smod pa la /
translated: Anger is with regard to disparaging.

original: nye bar bcos pa ni sun 'byin pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar bcos pa ni sun 'byin pa nyid do //
translated: Correction is with regard to reproaching.

original: bsregs pa ni mi dge ba rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsregs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: bsregs pa ni mi dge ba rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsregs pa'i phyir la /
translated: Burning is with regard to the roots of virtue by nonvirtues.

original: 'dun pa ni dbang gi dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni dbang gi dngos po'o //
translated: Aspiration is the basis of power.

original: phyir bzlog pa ni 'dun pa las so //
analyzed: phyir bzlog pa ni 'dun pa las so //
translated: Turning away is from aspiration.

original: 'bral bar byed pa ni 'dis 'dun pa dang bral bar gyur pas bral bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bral bar byed pa ni 'dis 'dun pa dang bral bar gyur pas bral bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Separation is by this, because one becomes separated from aspiration.

original: mi 'jug par byed pa ni yid kyis gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jug par byed pa ni yid kyis gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-engagement is by the mind.

original: ldog par byed pa ni slar mi 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog par byed pa ni slar mi 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Turning back is by not taking up again.

original: 'di rnams kyis ni spong bar smra ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni spong bar smra ste /
translated: These are said to be abandoning.

original: spong bar smra ba ni 'di la bslab @114a * //
analyzed: spong bar smra ba ni 'di la bslab @114a * //
translated: Abandoning is said to be training in the perfection of wisdom.

original: par mi bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: par mi bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: One should not say it is not the word of the Buddha.

original: khro bar smra ba ni 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khro bar smra ba ni 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: To speak angrily is to say this is not the word of the Buddha.

original: de ltar ni dang po'i stobs rnams bcom pa'i sems rmongs pas rtogs na sha khon du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni dang po'i stobs rnams bcom pa'i sems rmongs pas rtogs na sha khon du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Thus, if one's mind is confused and one destroys the first powers, one will be hostile.

original: gang gi phyir mdo sde la 'jug pa 'dul ba la snang ba chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo sde la 'jug pa 'dul ba la snang ba chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung la /
translated: That which is not contrary to reality is the word of the Buddha, for it appears in the sutras, appears in the Vinaya, and is not contrary to reality.

original: theg pa chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni mdo sde la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni mdo sde la /
translated: The Mahayana perfection of wisdom and so on are sutras.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la sogs pa ni 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la sogs pa ni 'dul ba ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva Canon and so on are the Vinaya.

original: chos nyid ni khyad par du gyur pas bshad pa ni theg pa dman pa la ni theg pa chen po'i yon tan gyi tshogs med pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos nyid ni khyad par du gyur pas bshad pa ni theg pa dman pa la ni theg pa chen po'i yon tan gyi tshogs med pa nyid de /
translated: Reality is explained as a special transformation, for the collection of qualities of the Mahayana does not exist in the Hinayana.

original: khron pa la sogs pa la rgal ba med pa'i phyir dang / rgya mtsho chen po rnams kyi nang du ma song ba'i phyir na chu'i rten du ma gyur ces pa ste /
analyzed: khron pa la sogs pa la rgal ba med pa'i phyir dang / rgya mtsho chen po rnams kyi nang du ma song ba'i phyir na chu'i rten du ma gyur ces pa ste /
translated: Because there is no crossing over of wells, etc., and because they do not enter the great oceans, they are not the support of water.

original: 'dir mang du brjod pa ni dgos pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir mang du brjod pa ni dgos pa med pa nyid do //
translated: There is no need to say much about this.

original: byol song ni yongs su btang ba ste /
analyzed: byol song ni yongs su btang ba ste /
translated: Animals are abandoned.

original: phyi rol du 'gyur zhes pa dang don gcig go //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'gyur zhes pa dang don gcig go //
translated: This has the same meaning as ‚Äúbecome external.‚Äù

original: thams cad nas ni ji ltar gyur pa de ltar na /
analyzed: thams cad nas ni ji ltar gyur pa de ltar na /
translated: In every way means in all ways.

original: thams cad kyi ni yan lag gis so //üîΩthams cad ni ji ltar 'gyur ba de thams cad kyis te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni yan lag gis so // thams cad ni ji ltar 'gyur ba de thams cad kyis te /
translated: Every means by all parts.üîΩIn every way means in all ways.

original: bye brag rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bye brag rnams kyis so //
translated: By all means means by all distinctions.

original: las mngon par 'du byed pa ni las kyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: las mngon par 'du byed pa ni las kyi bya ba'o //
translated: The performance of action is the activity of action.

original: nye bar gnas pa ni byas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ni byas pa'o //
translated: Abiding is the state of being made.

original: kun nas bslang ba ni nye bar bsags pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas bslang ba ni nye bar bsags pa'o //
translated: Accumulation is the state of being collected.

original: 'jig pa ni bshig pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni bshig pa ste /
translated: Destruction is the state of being destroyed.

original: gang gis mes zad par byed pa de ni mes 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis mes zad par byed pa de ni mes 'jig pa'o //
translated: That which is destroyed by fire is the destruction by fire.

original: 'dor bar 'gyur ba ni srid pa bar ma'i lus kyis so //
analyzed: 'dor bar 'gyur ba ni srid pa bar ma'i lus kyis so //
translated: That which is discarded is by the body of the intermediate existence.

original: ltung bar 'gyur ba ni skye ba'i lus kyis te /
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur ba ni skye ba'i lus kyis te /
translated: The body of birth is the basis of the downfall.

original: rgyud mnyam du yang sdug bsngal mang po rnams des gang gi phyir de ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud mnyam du yang sdug bsngal mang po rnams des gang gi phyir de ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And because of that, one experiences many sufferings in the same continuum.

original: ma bsad pa dang / pha bsad pa dang / dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba zhes pa ni mtshams med pa lnga'i las te /
analyzed: ma bsad pa dang / pha bsad pa dang / dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba zhes pa ni mtshams med pa lnga'i las te /
translated: The five heinous actions are killing one's mother, killing one's father, killing an arhat, causing a schism in the order, and maliciously drawing blood from a tathagata.

original: bar mtshams med par mnar med par skye ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bar mtshams med par mnar med par skye ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro ;
translated: They are called heinous actions because they are the cause for being born in Avici Hell without interruption.

original: / mtshams med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams dang 'dra ba med pas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs brnyan du yang ngam /
analyzed: / mtshams med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams dang 'dra ba med pas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs brnyan du yang ngam /
translated: They are called heinous actions because they are similar to the cause and result of the heinous actions, and they are not even a reflection,

original: rjes su mthun pa'am tshul mthun pa tsam yang ma yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'am tshul mthun pa tsam yang ma yin zhes pa ste /
translated: or a similitude, or a semblance of the heinous actions.

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni don mthun pa'i shes pa ni gzhan dag gi'o//
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni don mthun pa'i shes pa ni gzhan dag gi'o//
translated: The three terms reflection and so on refer to the consciousness of a similar object, which is that of others.

original: @114b rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni de nyid las te /
analyzed: @114b rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni de nyid las te /
translated: and gain and honor from that very thing.

original: ci'i phyir na de la lta bar yang ngo //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na de la lta bar yang ngo //
translated: Why? Because of looking at that.

original: so rtsi'i lo ma'i 'dab ma rul ba ni /
analyzed: so rtsi'i lo ma'i 'dab ma rul ba ni /
translated: A rotten leaf of the castor plant

original: de ma por na gzhan rnams kyang 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ma por na gzhan rnams kyang 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: destroys the others when it falls.

original: so rtsi'i lo ma bzhin du rigs su skyes pa 'di rnams de bzhin no //
analyzed: so rtsi'i lo ma bzhin du rigs su skyes pa 'di rnams de bzhin no //
translated: So it is with those born in a family like the castor plant.

original: nag po ni rtsva'i bye brag la sred ni rab tu grags pa ste /
analyzed: nag po ni rtsva'i bye brag la sred ni rab tu grags pa ste /
translated: Black is a kind of grass, and worm is well known.

original: zhing la ma bsal na zhing 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhing la ma bsal na zhing 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: If it is not removed from the field, it destroys the field.

original: nag po'ang srin bu zhes pa kha cig ste /
analyzed: nag po'ang srin bu zhes pa kha cig ste /
translated: Some say black worm.

original: nag po rang bzhin gyi rigs las skyes pa 'di rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nag po rang bzhin gyi rigs las skyes pa 'di rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: So it is with those born in a family of naturally bad disposition.

original: nag po la ni reg nas so ma btab kyang dug dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nag po la ni reg nas so ma btab kyang dug dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if not cut, it becomes poisonous just by contact with the black one.

original: 'di nyid kyis na de dag las nyan pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa rnams lam ma yin pas phongs shing dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis na de dag las nyan pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa rnams lam ma yin pas phongs shing dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis te /
translated: By this very thing, those who listen to them and have faith in them are deprived by the non-path and by the suffering of hell and so on.

original: sdug cing drag la gnod pa chen pos so //
analyzed: sdug cing drag la gnod pa chen pos so //
translated: By great suffering, intense and painful.

original: snang bar byas pa ni rang bzhin gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa shes par ro //
analyzed: snang bar byas pa ni rang bzhin gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa shes par ro //
translated: Illuminated means knowing the ripening of natural karma.

original: dkar po'i skal ba ni dge ba'i skal ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i skal ba ni dge ba'i skal ba'o //
translated: White portion means virtuous portion.

original: de dang ldan par ni yang dag par skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan par ni yang dag par skyed pa'o //
translated: Endowed with that means perfectly generated.

original: sbyor ba zhes pa ni chos kyis phongs pas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes pa ni chos kyis phongs pas so //
translated: Application means by being bereft of the Dharma.

original: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa gsungs la /
analyzed: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa gsungs la /
translated: Blessed by Mara, etc. means blessed by Mara.

original: chos zab mo la mi mos pas de la dad pa dang dang ba med par gsungs so //
analyzed: chos zab mo la mi mos pas de la dad pa dang dang ba med par gsungs so //
translated: Lacking devotion and clarity towards that means lacking devotion and clarity towards the profound Dharma.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa rgyu rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa rgyu rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa ni /
translated: Moreover, etc. means the four types of causes.

original: bdag la bstod pa dang gzhan la smod pa nyes pa'i skabs tshol bar 'gyur zhes pa ni phung po gcig la /
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa dang gzhan la smod pa nyes pa'i skabs tshol bar 'gyur zhes pa ni phung po gcig la /
translated: Praising oneself and disparaging others means seeking opportunities for faults.

original: bstan bcos su ni de'i 'dir chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu drug gsungs pa la mdor bsdus nas bzhi ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos su ni de'i 'dir chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu drug gsungs pa la mdor bsdus nas bzhi ste /
translated: In the treatise, here the six causes of being bereft of the Dharma are stated in brief as four.

original: lhag ma rnams ni phung po la sogs par mngon par zhen ba'i nang du bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni phung po la sogs par mngon par zhen ba'i nang du bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: The rest are included in the internal clinging to the aggregates, etc.

original: bdag la bstod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis phung po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis phung po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, etc. are the objects of clinging in the self-praise, etc.

original: sgrub pa'i le'u 'dir yan lag bdun gyis sgrub pa gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i le'u 'dir yan lag bdun gyis sgrub pa gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this chapter on practice, practice is clarified by seven limbs.

original: de ltar na yang ngan 'gro'i gzhung mang ba'i phyir dmyal ba'i le'u brjod pa ste bdun pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar na yang ngan 'gro'i gzhung mang ba'i phyir dmyal ba'i le'u brjod pa ste bdun pa'o /
translated: Thus, the seventh chapter, the Hell Chapter, is spoken in order to show the many scriptures on bad destinies.üîΩThe Pure Chapter

original: // / dag pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / dag pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the Pure Chapter is spoken.

original: de ni mos par dka' ba nyid pas de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ni mos par dka' ba nyid pas de gsungs pa ni /
translated: Since it is difficult to believe, it is said:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, etc.

original: don du mi gnyer ba ni 'dun pa dman pas so //
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba ni 'dun pa dman pas so //
translated: Not seeking is due to inferior aspiration.

original: nye bar bstan pa ni bgegs kyis so //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa ni bgegs kyis so //
translated: Not teaching is due to obstacles.

original: legs par mi nyan pa la sogs pa ni dge ba'i bshes @115a * //üîΩgnyen rnams la'o //
analyzed: legs par mi nyan pa la sogs pa ni dge ba'i bshes @115a * // gnyen rnams la'o //
translated: Not listening well, etc. is to spiritual friends.

original: ji tsam du zab pa zhes pa ni ming tsam du zab pas mos par dka' ba la /
analyzed: ji tsam du zab pa zhes pa ni ming tsam du zab pas mos par dka' ba la /
translated: As deep as, etc. is difficult to believe due to the depth of mere names.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa la yang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa la yang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: Form, etc. are not bound and not liberated in the prior limit, etc.

original: dus gsum gyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not exist in the three times.

original: mchog tu mos par dka' ba ni mchog tu zab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu mos par dka' ba ni mchog tu zab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to believe the supreme because it is supremely profound.

original: snga nas rab tu 'jug pa ni 'ching ba la snga nas dag pa'i phyir de ldog pa'i thar pa ste /
analyzed: snga nas rab tu 'jug pa ni 'ching ba la snga nas dag pa'i phyir de ldog pa'i thar pa ste /
translated: It is the prior engagement because it is pure prior to bondage. Liberation is the cessation of that.

original: dag pa zhes rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa zhes rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: It is well known as purity.

original: 'dir yang bcings pa dang / grol ba dag ni shin tu med cing dag pa zhes pa ni mchog tu zab pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang bcings pa dang / grol ba dag ni shin tu med cing dag pa zhes pa ni mchog tu zab pa'o //
translated: Here, bondage and liberation are utterly non-existent, and purity is supremely profound.

original: rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bstan bcos las /
translated: The characteristic of purity is stated in the treatise:

original: 'bras bu dag pa gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag pa gzugs la sogs //
translated: The purity of the result is form, etc.

original: dag pa nyid de gang gi phyir //
analyzed: dag pa nyid de gang gi phyir //
translated: It is purity because

original: de gnyis tha dad ma yin zhing //
analyzed: de gnyis tha dad ma yin zhing //
translated: those two are not different

original: bcad du med pas dag par brjod //
analyzed: bcad du med pas dag par brjod //
translated: and are indivisible, thus it is called purity.

original: ces te / 'bras bu dag pa ni bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces te / 'bras bu dag pa ni bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The purity of the result is what is to be accomplished.

original: de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i dag pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is the purity of form, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes pa ni de la 'dis gong du mos par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes pa ni de la 'dis gong du mos par dka' ba'o //
translated: Why is that? It is difficult to believe that.

original: gnyis su med pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis la /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis la /
translated: Non-dual means by its very nature.

original: gnyis su byar med pa ni phan tshun du ma 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med pa ni phan tshun du ma 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Indivisible means not confused with each other.

original: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni tha mi dad cing gcad du med pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni tha mi dad cing gcad du med pa zhes pa'o //
translated: This is explained as ‚Äúindivisible and uninterruptible.‚Äù

original: yum chen mor gsungs pa'i rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye ba'i phyir bstan bcos su /üîΩnyon mongs shes bya lam gsum gyi //
analyzed: yum chen mor gsungs pa'i rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye ba'i phyir bstan bcos su / nyon mongs shes bya lam gsum gyi //
translated: In order to teach the divisions of the purity taught in the Great Mother, the treatise states:üîΩThe purity of the disciples, the rhinoceroses,

original: nyams phyir slob ma bse ru dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi dag pa ste //
analyzed: nyams phyir slob ma bse ru dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi dag pa ste //
translated: and the heirs of the victors is due toüîΩthe degeneration of the afflictions, the knowable, and the path, respectively.üîΩThe purity of the buddhas is due to

original: sangs rgyas rnam kun shin tu bzhes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam kun shin tu bzhes te /
translated: all aspects.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / lam dang gsum pa rnams la srid pa mi shes pa'i lam gsum des spangs pa rnam par dag pa ni go rims ji bzhin du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi sras la sangs rgyas rnams kyisüîΩni mtha'i mtshams de las shin tu 'das pas shin tu ba la shin tu ba ni srid pa mthar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / lam dang gsum pa rnams la srid pa mi shes pa'i lam gsum des spangs pa rnam par dag pa ni go rims ji bzhin du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi sras la sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni mtha'i mtshams de las shin tu 'das pas shin tu ba la shin tu ba ni srid pa mthar gyur pa ste /
translated: The complete abandonment of those is respectively the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.üîΩThe buddhas, the victors,üîΩare beyond that limit, for they are utterly beyond the three realms.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are utterly beyond the three realms because they abandon the obscurations together with their traces.

original: rnam kun ni rnam pa thams cad kyi ste /
analyzed: rnam kun ni rnam pa thams cad kyi ste /
translated: In all aspects means in all ways.üîΩThe extensive explanation of all aspects is as follows.

original: rnam kun zhes pa rgyas par bshad pa ni de la bstan bcos las /
analyzed: rnam kun zhes pa rgyas par bshad pa ni de la bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise attainment of knowledge states:

original: chung ngu'i chung la sogs pa'i lam //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung la sogs pa'i lam //
translated: The small of the small and so on are paths

original: dag pa sa dgu po rnams la //
analyzed: dag pa sa dgu po rnams la //
translated: on the nine pure stages.

original: chen po'i chen po la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po la sogs pa'i //
translated: The great of the great and so on

original: @115b dri ma yi ni gnyen po nyid //
analyzed: @115b dri ma yi ni gnyen po nyid //
translated: are antidotes to the stains.

original: ces te sa rnams la dag pa dgu ste /
analyzed: ces te sa rnams la dag pa dgu ste /
translated: Thus, there are nine purities on the stages.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa brgyad po rnams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa brgyad po rnams te /
translated: The desire realm and the eight levels of the form and formless realms.

original: lam so so la sa rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: lam so so la sa rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: The path of each stage has nine aspects.

original: chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa phye bas bye brag brgyad cu rtsa gcig la chen po'i chen po la sogs pa'i dbye bas sa re re la skyon rnam pa dgu dgu ste brgyad cu rtsa gcig gi gnyen pos so //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa phye bas bye brag brgyad cu rtsa gcig la chen po'i chen po la sogs pa'i dbye bas sa re re la skyon rnam pa dgu dgu ste brgyad cu rtsa gcig gi gnyen pos so //
translated: The nine aspects of each stage are divided into the small of the small and so on, making eighty-one distinctions. The antidote to each of the eighty-one is the nine aspects of each stage, such as the great of the great.

original: 'dir rnam pa dgu'i lam gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa dgu'i lam gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, the path of the nine aspects is stated:

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes pa ni lam chung ngu'i chung ngu dang chung ngu'i 'bring ngo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes pa ni lam chung ngu'i chung ngu dang chung ngu'i 'bring ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúOmniscience‚Äù and ‚Äúomniscience in all aspects‚Äù are the small of the small path and the small of the medium.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: zab mo'i gting dpag dka' ste /
analyzed: zab mo'i gting dpag dka' ste /
translated: The depth of the profound is difficult to fathom.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de kho na nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lam chung ngu'i chen po'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de kho na nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lam chung ngu'i chen po'o //
translated: For the sake of purification means because of the lack of inherent nature in reality. This is the greater of the small.

original: gsal bar bgyid pa ni mun pa sel ba ste /
analyzed: gsal bar bgyid pa ni mun pa sel ba ste /
translated: Illumination is the dispelling of darkness.

original: chos rnams thams cad rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'bring gi chung ngu'o //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'bring gi chung ngu'o //
translated: For the sake of the purification of all phenomena means the lesser of the medium.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa ni mthong ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa ni mthong ba ste /
translated: With light means with seeing.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'bring gi 'bring ngo //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'bring gi 'bring ngo //
translated: For the sake of purification means the medium of the medium.

original: mtshams sbyor ba mchis pa ni srid pa gzhan du 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba mchis pa ni srid pa gzhan du 'pho ba ste /
translated: With connection means with transference to another existence.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'bring gi chen po'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'bring gi chen po'o //
translated: For the sake of purification means the greater of the medium.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa ste /
translated: Without affliction means without the afflictions.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni chen po'i chung ngu'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni chen po'i chung ngu'o //
translated: For the sake of purification means because all phenomena are naturally unafflicted. This is the lesser of the great.

original: thob pa med cing mngon par rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: thob pa med cing mngon par rtogs pa med de /
translated: Without attainment and without realization means without the realization of the result.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni chos rnams thams cad thob pa med la mngon par rtogs pa med ces pa ni chen po'i 'bring ngo //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni chos rnams thams cad thob pa med la mngon par rtogs pa med ces pa ni chen po'i 'bring ngo //
translated: For the sake of purity, all phenomena are neither attained nor realized. This is the medium of the great.

original: mngon par grub pa ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa ma mchis pa ste /
translated: They are not established.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni chos rnams thams cad mngon par grub pa med ces pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni chos rnams thams cad mngon par grub pa med ces pa ste /
translated: For the sake of purity, all phenomena are not established.

original: lam chen po'i chen po'o //
analyzed: lam chen po'i chen po'o //
translated: This is the great of the great path.

original: rnam pa 'di dgu ni lam ste sa re re la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dgu ni lam ste sa re re la shes par bya'o //
translated: These nine aspects are the path, to be understood on each stage.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn replied:

original: shin tu skye ba ma mchis zhes pa la sogs pas lam shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu skye ba ma mchis zhes pa la sogs pas lam shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-arising‚Äù and so forth completely fulfills the knowledge of the path.

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Here, in the treatise it is said:

original: khams gsum pa yi gnyen po nyid //
analyzed: khams gsum pa yi gnyen po nyid //
translated: The antidote to the three realms

original: gzhal dang gzhal bya mnyam nyid la //üîΩklan ka yongs su spangs pa dang // lam yang de yi gnyer por 'dod //
analyzed: gzhal dang gzhal bya mnyam nyid la // klan ka yongs su spangs pa dang // lam yang de yi gnyer por 'dod //
translated: In the equality of the object of evaluation and the evaluator,üîΩThe thorough relinquishment of faults

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: And the path are asserted to be its antidote.

original: khams gsum pa'i ma skyes pa'i rnam par dag pa'i @116a * //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i ma skyes pa'i rnam par dag pa'i @116a * //
translated: The path of the purity of non-arising in the three realms

original: lam ste / de gsungs pa ni shin tu zhes pa ste /
analyzed: lam ste / de gsungs pa ni shin tu zhes pa ste /
translated: Is taught as ‚Äúthoroughly.‚Äù

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i ngo bor skye ba ma mchis pa zhes pa ni de'i khams gsum gyi gnyen po nyid la 'dir yang gzhal dang gzhal bya mnyam pa nyid gang du gsungs pa ni ma 'tshal ba ni mi 'dzin pa la
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i ngo bor skye ba ma mchis pa zhes pa ni de'i khams gsum gyi gnyen po nyid la 'dir yang gzhal dang gzhal bya mnyam pa nyid gang du gsungs pa ni ma 'tshal ba ni mi 'dzin pa la
translated: The phrase because of purity, there is no arising in the nature of the desire realm and so on refers to the antidote to the three realms. Here, the equality of the object of evaluation and the evaluator is not known, not apprehended,

original: yang dag par ma 'tshal ba ni rnam par rtog par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ma 'tshal ba ni rnam par rtog par mi byed pa'o //
translated: and is not known, not conceptualized.

original: de gsal bar 'dod nas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de gsal bar 'dod nas 'dri ba ni /
