translated: Desiring to clarify that, he asks,

original: ci zhig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci zhig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: What is the equality of the object of evaluation and the evaluator?

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni shin tu med pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni shin tu med pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: The phrase because of purity means because of utter nonexistence.

original: shes pa dang shes bya mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: It is the equality of consciousness and the object of consciousness.

original: klan ka ni 'dir rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bsgom pa'i lam du mi 'thad de zhes pa'i gang du skyon brgyad po 'dir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: klan ka ni 'dir rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bsgom pa'i lam du mi 'thad de zhes pa'i gang du skyon brgyad po 'dir gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, the fault is stated in the phrase the characteristic of purity is not tenable on the path of meditation. The eight faults are stated there.

original: lam gang de yang zhes pa'i yang ni kun du rtog pa dang tha dad pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: lam gang de yang zhes pa'i yang ni kun du rtog pa dang tha dad pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The word also in the phrase that path also indicates a different stage of conceptualization.

original: klan ka'i zhes pa ni skyed pa la dang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: klan ka'i zhes pa ni skyed pa la dang po'i tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúobjection‚Äù is the first word of the verse.

original: bsgom pa'i lam nyid du mi 'dod la 'dir klan ka de rnams kyi lan ni gong du btab ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam nyid du mi 'dod la 'dir klan ka de rnams kyi lan ni gong du btab ces pa'i don to //
translated: The reply to those objections was given above, but they are not accepted as being on the path of meditation.

original: 'di'i grub mtha' la de ltar zhum par 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i grub mtha' la de ltar zhum par 'dri ba ste /
translated: This is the question that is asked about the conclusion of this [path of meditation].

original: 'di ni zhes pa ni rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i klan ka smos pa ste /üîΩklan ka gzhan brgyad po rnams la /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa ni rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i klan ka smos pa ste / klan ka gzhan brgyad po rnams la /
translated: The word ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the objection that it is dependent on a cause.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i rgyu ni lam brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i rgyu ni lam brgyad po rnams so //
translated: The conclusion is the cause of the eight paths.

original: phan par yang mi bgyid la gnod par yang mi bgyid ces pa ni grub pa'i mtha' la /
analyzed: phan par yang mi bgyid la gnod par yang mi bgyid ces pa ni grub pa'i mtha' la /
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not benefit and it does not harm‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: gal te de gang du cung zhig mi byed na de gang du ji ltar na lam zhes pa ni klan ka la /
analyzed: gal te de gang du cung zhig mi byed na de gang du ji ltar na lam zhes pa ni klan ka la /
translated: If it does not do anything anywhere, then how is it a path anywhere? This is the objection.

original: lan ni rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: lan ni rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ste /
translated: The reply is ‚Äúbecause of purity.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa nyid de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa nyid de /
translated: Omniscience is the purity of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas de'i de la ni 'dir cung zad byed du med la /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas de'i de la ni 'dir cung zad byed du med la /
translated: Moreover, since it is pure by nature, there is nothing to be done here with respect to it.

original: glo bur gyi sgrib pa 'ba' zhig zad par 'dod pa la brjod do //
analyzed: glo bur gyi sgrib pa 'ba' zhig zad par 'dod pa la brjod do //
translated: It is said that the mere exhaustion of adventitious obscurations is desired.

original: mi 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha' la /
analyzed: mi 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha' la /
translated: The philosophical position is stated in the line ‚ÄúIf one does not apprehend . . . ‚Äù and so forth.

original: gal te bzung na rnam par rtog par gyur la de nas mi 'dzin pa ni shes rab nyid du mi 'gyur zhes pa ni klan ka ste /
analyzed: gal te bzung na rnam par rtog par gyur la de nas mi 'dzin pa ni shes rab nyid du mi 'gyur zhes pa ni klan ka ste /
translated: The objection is that if one apprehends, then one becomes conceptual, and then, not apprehending, one would not have wisdom.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lan te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lan te /
translated: The response is ‚Äúbecause of purity.‚Äù

original: gang du 'di ltar chos 'di dag ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir don dam par na mngon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang du 'di ltar chos 'di dag ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir don dam par na mngon pa med pa ste /
translated: Since phenomena are like this, because they are essenceless, ultimately they are not seen.

original: de'i phyir mthong pa med pa'i sbyor bas mthong ba ste de nyid kyis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong pa med pa'i sbyor bas mthong ba ste de nyid kyis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by the application of not seeing, one sees. By that very fact, the perfection of wisdom is pure.

original: rnam par @116b dag pa'i phyir mi 'dzin pa ni don dam pa la /
analyzed: rnam par @116b dag pa'i phyir mi 'dzin pa ni don dam pa la /
translated: Because of purity, one does not apprehend ultimately.

original: kun rdzob tu ni gtong ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni gtong ba'o //
translated: Conventionally, one does let go.

original: phung po rnam par dag pa dang 'bras bu rnam par dag pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phung po rnam par dag pa dang 'bras bu rnam par dag pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
translated: The purity of the aggregates, the purity of the result, and the purity of omniscience are taught.

original: de yang de rnam par dag pas bdag rnam par dag pa ste ji ltar bdag rnam par shin tu med pa don dam par zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' la /
analyzed: de yang de rnam par dag pas bdag rnam par dag pa ste ji ltar bdag rnam par shin tu med pa don dam par zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' la /
translated: Moreover, by their purity, the self is pure. Just as the self is utterly nonexistent, ultimately, according to the tenets.

original: gal te phung po dang 'bras bu dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnams shin tu med na /
analyzed: gal te phung po dang 'bras bu dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnams shin tu med na /
translated: If the aggregates, the result, and omniscience do not exist at all,

original: 'di ni cung zad min zhes pa ni klan ka la /
analyzed: 'di ni cung zad min zhes pa ni klan ka la /
translated: this is not so in the least. This is the objection.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lan no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lan no //
translated: Because of utter purity, is the reply.

original: don dam par chos rnams thams cad shin tu med pa nyid /
analyzed: don dam par chos rnams thams cad shin tu med pa nyid /
translated: Ultimately, all phenomena are utterly nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir na de stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi chos nyid la de yang kun rdzob dang ro gcig pas yod ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi chos nyid la de yang kun rdzob dang ro gcig pas yod ces pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, in the reality that is the nature of emptiness, that also exists, because it is of one taste with the conventional. This is the meaning of ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: bdag rnam par dag pas thob pa yang med la mngon par rtogs pa yang med ces pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la thob pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis thob ces pa ste klan ka ni snga ma
analyzed: bdag rnam par dag pas thob pa yang med la mngon par rtogs pa yang med ces pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la thob pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis thob ces pa ste klan ka ni snga ma
translated: The philosophical tenet that there is no attainment and no realization due to the purity of the self is that attainment is by the uninterrupted path and realization is by the liberated path.

original: bzhin la / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lan te /
analyzed: bzhin la / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lan te /
translated: The response to the objection is as above.

original: gang du 'di ltar chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyis chos rnams shin tu med la /
analyzed: gang du 'di ltar chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyis chos rnams shin tu med la /
translated: Since it is utterly pure means that since phenomena do not exist in that way by the nature of phenomena,

original: de'i de nyid kyi chos dang ro gcig pas kun rdzob tu yod de /
analyzed: de'i de nyid kyi chos dang ro gcig pas kun rdzob tu yod de /
translated: they exist conventionally because they are of the same taste as that suchness.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis dag pa ste /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis dag pa ste /
translated: Moreover, that is pure by nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid la ni thams cad mkhyen pa de ltar mi 'gyur bas thob pas mngon par rtogs pa med ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la ni thams cad mkhyen pa de ltar mi 'gyur bas thob pas mngon par rtogs pa med ces pa'i don to //
translated: Since that nature is not changed by omniscience, there is no realization by attainment.

original: bdag med pas gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa mu med pa zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' la /
analyzed: bdag med pas gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa mu med pa zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' la /
translated: The philosophical tenet that form, feeling, and so on are limitless because of selflessness is as follows.

original: de gang du mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phung po la sogs pa'i mtha' ni de ji ltar mu med pa yin zhes pa ni klan ka ste /
analyzed: de gang du mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phung po la sogs pa'i mtha' ni de ji ltar mu med pa yin zhes pa ni klan ka ste /
translated: Where is it seen? The aggregates and so on are the limit. How can they be limitless? This is the objection.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lan te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lan te /
translated: The reply is: because of complete purity.

original: ji ltar na bdag ni shin tu med pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag ni shin tu med pa nyid de /
translated: How is the self completely nonexistent?

original: de'i phyir gang yang gzugs la sogs pa yang de kho na nyid du de la med pa de rnams kyi mu ji ltar chos nyid dang ro gcig pas ro gcig pa yod pa min nam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang gzugs la sogs pa yang de kho na nyid du de la med pa de rnams kyi mu ji ltar chos nyid dang ro gcig pas ro gcig pa yod pa min nam zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since form and so on do not exist in it in reality, how can they be its limit? Since they are of the same taste as reality, how can they not be of the same taste?

original: de ni rang gi ngo bos stong pa'i shin tu yang mu med pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / khyad par can de'i dbye ba ni don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bos stong pa'i shin tu yang mu med pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / khyad par can de'i dbye ba ni don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the complete absence of limit is the universal characteristic of all phenomena, it is empty of its own nature.

original: de'i phyir gang yang gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa de nyid 'bras bu rnam par dag pa dang / thams @117a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa de nyid 'bras bu rnam par dag pa dang / thams @117a * //
translated: Therefore, the purity of form and so on is itself the purity of the result, and the purity of the result is itself the purity of the basis.

original: cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúpurification of the knowledge of all things‚Äù is the same as the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúpurification of the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: gang de de ltar don dam par med pa chos rnams thams cad rtogs pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' la /
analyzed: gang de de ltar don dam par med pa chos rnams thams cad rtogs pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' la /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe realization of all things as ultimately nonexistent is the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: de gal te de gang du rtogs na de ltar na shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin zhes pa ni klan ka la /
analyzed: de gal te de gang du rtogs na de ltar na shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin zhes pa ni klan ka la /
translated: The objection is: ‚ÄúIf it is realized as that, then it is not utterly pure.‚Äù

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni lan te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni lan te /
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúBecause it is utterly pure.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid 'di'i shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'di'i shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: This is its utter purity.

original: gang gis 'dir don dam par shin tu med par rang dang chos thams cad rtogs shing mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'dir don dam par shin tu med par rang dang chos thams cad rtogs shing mthong ba'o //
translated: It is the realization and seeing of itself and all things as utterly nonexistent ultimately.

original: gang du chos rnams thams cad kun rdzob tu ni yod cing don dam par ni shin tu med de dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rtogs pa las skyes pa ni de ltar klan ka dang lan no //
analyzed: gang du chos rnams thams cad kun rdzob tu ni yod cing don dam par ni shin tu med de dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rtogs pa las skyes pa ni de ltar klan ka dang lan no //
translated: The answer is that phenomena exist conventionally and do not exist ultimately.

original: lam shes pa'i rjes la de rnams bde bar rtogs pa'am rnam par spros pa'i don du thams cad shes pa nyid brjod par bya la /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i rjes la de rnams bde bar rtogs pa'am rnam par spros pa'i don du thams cad shes pa nyid brjod par bya la /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is described as the realization of those aspects or the full development of them after the knowledge of the path.üîΩIt has eight actual bases.

original: de ni dngos po brgyad de de ltar yang bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de ni dngos po brgyad de de ltar yang bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: shes pas srid la mi gnas shing //
analyzed: shes pas srid la mi gnas shing //
translated: Through knowledge, one does not abide in existenceüîΩand through compassion, one does not abide in peace.üîΩIt is not distant because of being all-knowing

original: snying rjes zhi la mi gnas dang // thams ma yin pas ring ba dang // thabs kyis ring ba ma yin nyid //
analyzed: snying rjes zhi la mi gnas dang // thams ma yin pas ring ba dang // thabs kyis ring ba ma yin nyid //
translated: and it is not distant through method.üîΩIt is the antidote to the discordant factorsüîΩand it is the union of the two.

original: mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag dang // sbyor dang de yi mnyam nyid dang // nyan thos la sogs mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag dang // sbyor dang de yi mnyam nyid dang // nyan thos la sogs mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The path of seeing of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on

original: de 'dra kun shes nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: de 'dra kun shes nyid du 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ces la / 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ces la / 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa ni /
translated: The extensive explanation of this is as follows.

original: tshu rol pha rol mtha' la min //
analyzed: tshu rol pha rol mtha' la min //
translated: It is not this side or the other side or the end.

original: de dag bar na mi gnas shing //
analyzed: de dag bar na mi gnas shing //
translated: They do not abide in between,

original: dus rnams mnyam pa nyid shes phyir //
analyzed: dus rnams mnyam pa nyid shes phyir //
translated: because of knowing the equality of the times.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin par 'dod //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin par 'dod //
translated: That is asserted as the perfection of wisdom.

original: ces te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: ces te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad shes pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the knowledge of all things.

original: tshu rol ni 'khor ba la pha rol ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tshu rol ni 'khor ba la pha rol ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: This side is samsara, the other side is nirvana.

original: bar ni dbus la yang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bar ni dbus la yang mi gnas pa ste /
translated: They do not abide in between,

original: gsum char mi dmigs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsum char mi dmigs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is that all three are not apprehended.

original: shes rab dang snying rje dag yang dag par rig pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang gnyi ga'i nye bar dmigs pa dang bral bas gang du yang ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje dag yang dag par rig pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang gnyi ga'i nye bar dmigs pa dang bral bas gang du yang ste /
translated: By means of the correct knowledge of wisdom and compassion, one is free from the apprehension of both samsara and nirvana, and so one does not abide anywhere.

original: chos nyid la ni dus gsum mnyam pa'i phyir dang / chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / de gsungs pa ni tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid la ni dus gsum mnyam pa'i phyir dang / chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / de gsungs pa ni tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because the three times are equal in reality, because phenomena are not apprehended as having any essence, and because that is taught, the Venerable One said,

original: de ni thun mong du sngon bshad nas 'dir ni khyad @117b par gyi rang bzhin la'am /
analyzed: de ni thun mong du sngon bshad nas 'dir ni khyad @117b par gyi rang bzhin la'am /
translated: This is explained in the common way above. Here, it is the nature of the special.

original: yang na gang du yang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gang du yang mi gnas pa ste /
translated: Or, it is not located anywhere.

original: gang gi rang bzhin dang bral ba rjes su mi dmigs pa gsum gyis mi gnod pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin dang bral ba rjes su mi dmigs pa gsum gyis mi gnod pa rnams so //
translated: It is not harmed by the three: the nature of which is not found, the subsequent non-observation, and the non-observation of anything.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni don dam par yod pa ma yin pas chos rnams rtag tu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni don dam par yod pa ma yin pas chos rnams rtag tu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because of being extremely pure means that because they do not exist ultimately, phenomena are always extremely pure.

original: / nyan thos rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i ma rig pa tsam po spang ba'i rang gi sdug bsngal zad pa tsam po tshol te /
analyzed: / nyan thos rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i ma rig pa tsam po spang ba'i rang gi sdug bsngal zad pa tsam po tshol te /
translated: ≈örƒÅvakas seek to eliminate just the afflictive ignorance and just the suffering of their own continuum.

original: 'khor ba yongs su brtags shing shin tu yid byung nas mya ngan las 'das par brtags shing de shin tu 'dod nas 'bad pa nyid kyis myur ba myur ba nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su brtags shing shin tu yid byung nas mya ngan las 'das par brtags shing de shin tu 'dod nas 'bad pa nyid kyis myur ba myur ba nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Having thoroughly examined sa·πÉsƒÅra and become disgusted with it, they examine nirvƒÅ·πáa and, desiring it, quickly and quickly strive to attain nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are not like that.

original: sems can thams cad kyi phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub 'dod ces pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub 'dod ces pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid de /
translated: Since it is said, for the sake of all sentient beings, I desire unsurpassed enlightenment, it is not dwelling in cyclic existence or in nirvana.

original: de ni bstan bcos las /üîΩde yi mtshan bcas dmigs sgo nas //
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos las / de yi mtshan bcas dmigs sgo nas //
translated: This is stated in the treatise:üîΩIt is distant through the door of observing with signs,

original: thabs ma yin par ring ba ste //
analyzed: thabs ma yin par ring ba ste //
translated: and it is distant through the door of nonmethod.

original: zhes te / mtshan ma dang bcas par dmigs pas thabs ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te / mtshan ma dang bcas par dmigs pas thabs ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a method because it observes with signs.

original: 'di ltar yang zhes pa ni ming dang mtshan ma dag gis la /üîΩgsog tu byed par 'gyur ba dang / gsob tu byed pa ni ming gis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang zhes pa ni ming dang mtshan ma dag gis la / gsog tu byed par 'gyur ba dang / gsob tu byed pa ni ming gis so //
translated: Also means with regard to names and signs.üîΩIt is made hollow by names and made empty by signs.

original: rgyang ring du byed par 'gyur zhes pa ni mtshan mas rgyang ring du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyang ring du byed par 'gyur zhes pa ni mtshan mas rgyang ring du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is made distant by signs.

original: bstan bcos las /üîΩde ni thabs la mkhas pa yis //üîΩyang dag nye ba nyid du bshad //
analyzed: bstan bcos las / de ni thabs la mkhas pa yis // yang dag nye ba nyid du bshad //
translated: The treatise states:üîΩIt is explained as being very close

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: through being skilled in method.

original: chags pa med par 'jug pa ni thabs la mkhas pa la chags pa dang zhen pa dang bden pa dang cig shos kyi ngo bo ni sgro btags pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa med par 'jug pa ni thabs la mkhas pa la chags pa dang zhen pa dang bden pa dang cig shos kyi ngo bo ni sgro btags pa ste /
translated: The engagement without attachment is the skill in means. The attachment, clinging, truth, and other nature are the superimpositions.

original: de la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: de de bzhin no zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is just so, and so forth.‚Äù

original: legs par bshad pa ni mthong ba'i lam du skad cig bcu drug rnams kyis so //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa ni mthong ba'i lam du skad cig bcu drug rnams kyis so //
translated: The good explanation is by the sixteen moments of the path of seeing.

original: legs par bstan pa ni sbyor ba bcu gnyis rnams kyis so //
analyzed: legs par bstan pa ni sbyor ba bcu gnyis rnams kyis so //
translated: The good teaching is by the twelve applications.

original: shin tu mthar gtugs pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas pas so //
analyzed: shin tu mthar gtugs pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas pas so //
translated: The thorough conclusion is by not abiding in sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: shin tu yongs su dag pa ni chags pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par spangs pas so //
analyzed: shin tu yongs su dag pa ni chags pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par spangs pas so //
translated: The thorough purity is by abandoning the extremes of attachment.

original: gang du yang ji tsam dag ni tshig gi rgyan no //
analyzed: gang du yang ji tsam dag ni tshig gi rgyan no //
translated: Where and how much are the ornaments of words.

original: ngo mtshar ni ming la'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar ni ming la'o //
translated: The wonder is in the name.

original: chags pa spong ba'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes pa ni nye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: chags pa spong ba'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes pa ni nye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The skill in means for abandoning attachment is the approach.

original: de yang chags pa rnams spyir bstan nas khyad par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang chags pa rnams spyir bstan nas khyad par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, after teaching attachment in general, it should be explained in particular.

original: @118a * // 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: @118a * // 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Here, the treatise states:üîΩThe emptiness of the aggregates of form and so forth,üîΩthe phenomena realized in the three times,

original: gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid dang // dus gsum rtogs pa'i chos rnams dang // sbyin sogs byang chub phyogs rnams la //
analyzed: gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid dang // dus gsum rtogs pa'i chos rnams dang // sbyin sogs byang chub phyogs rnams la //
translated: and the factors of enlightenment such as generosity,

original: spyod pa'i 'du shes mi mthun phyogs //
analyzed: spyod pa'i 'du shes mi mthun phyogs //
translated: the perception of conduct is the opposing factor.

original: zhes te / gzugs la sogs pa ni chos rnams la phung po ni spungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te / gzugs la sogs pa ni chos rnams la phung po ni spungs pa'o //
translated: Form and so forth are the phenomena. The aggregates are heaps.

original: spyod pa'i 'du shes te /
analyzed: spyod pa'i 'du shes te /
translated: The perception of conduct is

original: ming ngam mtshan mar byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid pas mi mthun phyogs te /
analyzed: ming ngam mtshan mar byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid pas mi mthun phyogs te /
translated: the opposing factor, because it is the opposing factor of the name or sign.

original: chags pa dang bcas zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas zhes pa'i don te /
translated: It means being attached.

original: de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni /
translated: That is stated

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: in the line beginning with ‚Äúthen‚Äù and so forth.

original: yum bar mar sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la spyad par bya zhes par kun tu shes pa ni chags pa'o zhes gsungs pa rnams ni 'dir nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yum bar mar sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la spyad par bya zhes par kun tu shes pa ni chags pa'o zhes gsungs pa rnams ni 'dir nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the middle mother, it is said that the perfection of generosity and so forth and the practice of the factors of enlightenment are fully known to be attachment. Those statements are obtained here for the purpose of illustration.

original: chags pa lhag ma gsungs pa ni 'di tsam du bskyed ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa lhag ma gsungs pa ni 'di tsam du bskyed ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The remaining attachments are stated in ‚Äújust this much is generated,‚Äù and so on.üîΩBy what enumeration?

original: rnam grangs gang gis zhes pa ni bye brag gi lam 'di ni byang chub kyi sems dang po zhes pa ni rtogs pas dang por chags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis zhes pa ni bye brag gi lam 'di ni byang chub kyi sems dang po zhes pa ni rtogs pas dang por chags pa'o //
translated: This is the path of distinction. ‚Äú This is the first thought of awakening‚Äù is the first attachment through realization.

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya zhes pa ni rnam par brtags nas yongs su bsngo ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya zhes pa ni rnam par brtags nas yongs su bsngo ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It should be dedicated to awakening‚Äù is the second through the dedication of the imagined.

original: 'di'i chags pa ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang / sems mi rtog pa la de'i phyir gsungs pa ni mi nus zhes pa ni sems rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la /
analyzed: 'di'i chags pa ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang / sems mi rtog pa la de'i phyir gsungs pa ni mi nus zhes pa ni sems rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la /
translated: Here, since the attachment to this is ultimately without entityness, and since the nonconceptual mind is not able to do that, it is said that ‚Äúit is not possible.‚Äù

original: chags par brjod pa de rnams spong ba'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chags par brjod pa de rnams spong ba'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement for the purpose of abandoning those attachments that are said to be in the naturally entityless mind is

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: as stated in the treatise here:

original: sbyin pa la sogs ngar 'dzin med //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs ngar 'dzin med //
translated: Generosity and so on are without grasping,üîΩand introducing others to that

original: gzhan dag de la 'dzud pa dang // de ni chags pa'i mtha' 'gog par//
analyzed: gzhan dag de la 'dzud pa dang // de ni chags pa'i mtha' 'gog par//
translated: is the cessation of the extreme of attachment.

original: zhes te sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams la ngar 'dzin pa med pa ni dngos po nyid du mngon par rlom pa med pa'i mthus te /
analyzed: zhes te sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams la ngar 'dzin pa med pa ni dngos po nyid du mngon par rlom pa med pa'i mthus te /
translated: Thus, the absence of self-grasping in generosity and so forth is due to the power of not falsely projecting things.

original: sngon du bshad nas /
analyzed: sngon du bshad nas /
translated: Having explained that previously,

original: gzhan dag rlom pa med pa de la 'dzud par gsungs pa ni de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag rlom pa med pa de la 'dzud par gsungs pa ni de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: the statement that one should introduce others to that absence of false projection is the passage beginning with ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: de'i ming zhes pa ni rang gi chags pa spangs pa de'i rgyus so //
analyzed: de'i ming zhes pa ni rang gi chags pa spangs pa de'i rgyus so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat name‚Äù refers to the cause of abandoning one‚Äôs own attachment.

original: phyir zhes pa ni gzhan rnams la yang dag par ston pa la sogs pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: phyir zhes pa ni gzhan rnams la yang dag par ston pa la sogs pa'i dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor‚Äù refers to the time of teaching others correctly and so forth.

original: yang dag par bstan par bya ba ni sngon du thos pa dang mi ldan pa la nyan du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bya ba ni sngon du thos pa dang mi ldan pa la nyan du gzhug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúShould be taught correctly‚Äù means that those who previously lacked learning should be made to listen.

original: yang dag par dgod pa ni rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir yang dag par len du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par dgod pa ni rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir yang dag par len du gzhug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúShould be established correctly‚Äù means that they should be made to take up correctly in order to practice.

original: yang dag par gzengs @118b bstod pa ni bdag nyid kyis brod pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs @118b bstod pa ni bdag nyid kyis brod pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúShould be encouraged correctly‚Äù means that one should generate enthusiasm in oneself.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa legs so la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa legs so la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Correctly delighting is by the good and so forth of the undertaking of striving.

original: yang dag par rjes su rtogs pas ni chags pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su rtogs pas ni chags pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Correctly realizing is by the abandonment of attachment.

original: gnod par mi byed pa ni sangs rgyas rnams la gnod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par mi byed pa ni sangs rgyas rnams la gnod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not harming is by not harming the Buddhas.

original: de bzhin du ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis kyis chags pa'i mtha' rags pa rnams bkag nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis kyis chags pa'i mtha' rags pa rnams bkag nas /
translated: Similarly, by the two kinds of application, having stopped the coarse extremes of attachment, the subtle attachment to the Buddha, etc.

original: bstan bcos las /üîΩrgyal la sogs la chags pa phra //
analyzed: bstan bcos las / rgyal la sogs la chags pa phra //
translated: The treatise declares,üîΩAttachment to the Buddha, etc. is subtle.

original: zhes te / sangs rgyas la sogs pa gang la yang chags pa de yang phra mo ste /
analyzed: zhes te / sangs rgyas la sogs pa gang la yang chags pa de yang phra mo ste /
translated: Attachment to the Buddha, etc. is also subtle,

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni de dag dang gzhan dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa gang yang mtshan ma dang bcas pas dmigs pa ste /üîΩde gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni de dag dang gzhan dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa gang yang mtshan ma dang bcas pas dmigs pa ste / de gsungs pa ni /
translated: and the word etc. includes the rejoicing, etc. in the roots of virtue of those and others, which is by means of the observation of the sign.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is declared in the line beginning, Then again, etc.

original: de ni yongs su bsngo bar mi nus zhes pa ni dus gsum du thal bar 'gyur bas na mtshan mar byed par mi nus zhing dmigs par byed mi nus te /
analyzed: de ni yongs su bsngo bar mi nus zhes pa ni dus gsum du thal bar 'gyur bas na mtshan mar byed par mi nus zhing dmigs par byed mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be dedicated, because it would follow that the three times would be the same. Therefore, it cannot be made into a sign, and it cannot be objectified.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir dang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir dang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is without cause and difficult to realize.

original: gang dus gsum las grol zhes pa ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du mig gis dang / rna bas dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams kyis mi rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dus gsum las grol zhes pa ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du mig gis dang / rna bas dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams kyis mi rig pa nyid do //
translated: It is free from the three times, because it is not cognized by the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind, respectively.

original: mngon par byang ma chub ces pa ni gang du de rang bzhin nyid du cung zad med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang ma chub ces pa ni gang du de rang bzhin nyid du cung zad med pa'o //
translated: It is not fully awakened, because it does not exist in the least as their nature.

original: gang yang 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: And their nature is not a thing.

original: gang dngos po med pa de ni 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin la bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gang dngos po med pa de ni 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin la bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir la /

original: de ni gzugs dang tshor ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bar du yod pa min te /
analyzed: de ni gzugs dang tshor ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bar du yod pa min te /

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /üîΩchos kyi lam ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las / chos kyi lam ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Here, the treatise states:üîΩThe path of Dharma is profound

original: dben pa'i phyir na de zab nyid //
analyzed: dben pa'i phyir na de zab nyid //
translated: because it is empty by nature.

original: chos rnams rang bzhin gcig par ni //
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin gcig par ni //
translated: By knowing the single nature of phenomena,

original: shes pas chags pa spong ba yin //
analyzed: shes pas chags pa spong ba yin //
translated: attachment is abandoned.

original: mthong ba la sogs bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs bkag pa'i phyir //

analyzed: de ni rtogs par dka' bar bshad// gzugs la sogs par mi shes phyir //

original: de ni bsam mi khyab par 'dod //
analyzed: de ni bsam mi khyab par 'dod //

original: dben pa ni stong pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: dben pa ni stong pa'i phyir la /

original: chos kyi lam ni chos kyi tshogs rnams te //
analyzed: chos kyi lam ni chos kyi tshogs rnams te //

original: chos rnams rang bzhin gcig par shes //
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin gcig par shes //
translated: ‚ÄúBy knowing the single nature of phenomena‚Äù

original: zhes pa dang 'brel to //üîΩgcig @119a * //
analyzed: zhes pa dang 'brel to // gcig @119a * //

original: ces pa ni de rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang de la ste de ltar bshad do //

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Here, the treatise states:

original: de ltar kun shes nyid tshul la //
analyzed: de ltar kun shes nyid tshul la //
translated: Thus, in the manner of complete understanding,

original: mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag / rnam par dbye ba ma lus pa //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag / rnam par dbye ba ma lus pa //

original: ji skad bshad pa 'di shes bya //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa 'di shes bya //

analyzed: zhes te / 'di zhes pa ni chags pa dang chags pa med par brjod par byas pa'o //
translated: The it refers to the attachment and nonattachment that have been discussed.

original: de'i phyir chags pas dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa med cing dmigs pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chags pas dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa med cing dmigs pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /

original: gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs so //

original: sbyor ba rjod par byed pa ni 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: sbyor ba rjod par byed pa ni 'dir bstan bcos las /

original: gzugs sogs de mi rtag sogs dang // de ma rdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // sbyor ba bkag pas spyod pa ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de mi rtag sogs dang // de ma rdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // sbyor ba bkag pas spyod pa ni //

analyzed: de ni 'bras bu yod 'dod dang // gzhan la rag las min gang dang // shes byed rnam bdun snang ba la //

original: zhes te / de mi rtag sogs dang zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid dang rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te / de mi rtag sogs dang zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid dang rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The impermanence, etc. is the impermanence, permanence, etc. of form, etc.

original: rdzogs pa ni chags pa med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyir ni de'i sgras ni chags pa bzung ste ;
analyzed: rdzogs pa ni chags pa med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyir ni de'i sgras ni chags pa bzung ste ;

original: gnyi ga'i mnyam por zas bzhin gyi gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa dang ma chags pa dag gis so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i mnyam por zas bzhin gyi gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa dang ma chags pa dag gis so zhes pa'i don to //

original: spyod pa ni spyod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: spyod pa ni spyod pa byed pa ste /

analyzed: de dgag pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams la ste /

analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba bcu gnyis gsungs te /

original: 'dir de 'dra ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir de 'dra ba ni /

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar de zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: ji ltar na spyod par bgyi zhes pa ni ji ltar sbyor bar bgyi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na spyod par bgyi zhes pa ni ji ltar sbyor bar bgyi zhes pa'o //

analyzed: mi spyod na zhes pa ni yang dag par mi shes na'o //

analyzed: de la spyod ces pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phyir sbyor ba'o // gal te zhes pa la sogs pa la /

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa zhes mi spyod na ste /

analyzed: de la mi spyod ces pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid la @119b sogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //

analyzed: ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //

analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal zhes pa la sogs pa nas spyod par bya ba zhes pa'i bar gyis so //

original: 'dir zhen pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir zhen pa med pa ste /
translated: Here, without attachment,

original: chags pa thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all attachments are absent.

original: de las ma bcings pa ste /
analyzed: de las ma bcings pa ste /

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis so //

analyzed: de las ma grol ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams las so //

original: yang dag par ma 'das pa ni khams gsum las so //
analyzed: yang dag par ma 'das pa ni khams gsum las so //

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa la nye bar bsdu ba'o zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa dang ma chags pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa la nye bar bsdu ba'o zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa dang ma chags pa'i sbyor ba'o //

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med par 'gyur ba med pa ste nam mkha' bzhin la /
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med par 'gyur ba med pa ste nam mkha' bzhin la /

original: bsngags pas ni yon tan no zhes pa ni mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bsngags pas ni yon tan no zhes pa ni mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: By praise, the qualities. This is the application of immutability.

original: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: dang po'i kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba ni sgra'i don la khong khro bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Not first afflicted, not angry at the meaning of the words.

original: gnyis pa'i rjes su chags par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i rjes su chags par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: Not attached to the second,

original: bstan pa rnams la nyams pa dang 'phel bar mi byed pas byed pa po med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa rnams la nyams pa dang 'phel bar mi byed pas byed pa po med pa'i sbyor ba'o //

original: gnas brtan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das ma bsgom bar bya ba dga' bas de ltar gnas pa rnams kyi ched du bya ba la sogs pa rnams bya ba'i phyir de gsungs pa ni spyod pa ni zhi gnas kyis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma bsgom bar bya ba dga' bas de ltar gnas pa rnams kyi ched du bya ba la sogs pa rnams bya ba'i phyir de gsungs pa ni spyod pa ni zhi gnas kyis so //
translated: Since the Bhagavati is not to be meditated upon, for the sake of those who abide thus, the Bhagavati was taught for the sake of performing the activities of the elders and so on. The conduct is by means of shamatha.

original: zhus pa ni dman pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa ni dman pa'o //

original: ya ya po ni rgod pas so //
analyzed: ya ya po ni rgod pas so //

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni mi ldog pa'o //

analyzed: nam mkha' bsgom pa ni mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: nam mkha' dang zhes pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i rnal 'byor gyis so //

original: de mi gtong bas de'i bgyi ba dka' ba nyid do //
analyzed: de mi gtong bas de'i bgyi ba dka' ba nyid do //

original: sems can rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir dang / kun rdzob tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir dang / kun rdzob tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings are not perceived, and because they are infinite in the conventional.

original: 'gro ba'i don dang byang chub ched du byed pa de ni ched du bya ba'i go cha'o zhes pa ni ched du bya bar dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don dang byang chub ched du byed pa de ni ched du bya ba'i go cha'o zhes pa ni ched du bya bar dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That which is done for the sake of the world and enlightenment is the armor of the one who acts for the sake of others.

original: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ni /üîΩmtho ba dang 'gro ba'i bgegs bcom zhing yongs su thar par byed pa dang / mthon @120a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ni / mtho ba dang 'gro ba'i bgegs bcom zhing yongs su thar par byed pa dang / mthon @120a * //

analyzed: por mig 'degs pa ste 'di rnams dang ldan pa ni sems can don gyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the one who is endowed with these who is engaged in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de yang bya ba dka' ste nam mkha' bzhin du sems can gyi phung po la ngo bo nyid med pas dang kun rdzob tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sbyor ba dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de yang bya ba dka' ste nam mkha' bzhin du sems can gyi phung po la ngo bo nyid med pas dang kun rdzob tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sbyor ba dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni mi byed pa ste /

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos spong ba dang / rnam par byang ba can gyi chos skyed pa dang / de gnyi ga bya bar dka' ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos spong ba dang / rnam par byang ba can gyi chos skyed pa dang / de gnyi ga bya bar dka' ba ste /
translated: The practice is difficult because of the abandonment of defiled phenomena, the production of phenomena of purification, and the difficulty of doing both of those.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma la de dag gis mdzad pas zhes pa ni byed par dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma la de dag gis mdzad pas zhes pa ni byed par dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The Blessed Lady has done those, so it is the application of difficult practice.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: gang de ltar rnal 'byor du byed ces pa ni rgyu'i gnas skabs su la ci la zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar rnal 'byor du byed ces pa ni rgyu'i gnas skabs su la ci la zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su'o //

original: nam mkha' ni skar ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni skar ma'i lam ste /

original: 'dir de dang chos mthun pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: 'dir de dang chos mthun pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub bo //

analyzed: bla gab med pa ni sa steng du ma bkag pas gnas kyi tshul med pa can la /

original: 'dir ni de dang chos mthun pa ni dman pa'i byang chub bo //üîΩde ni gnyi ga'i 'bras bu la de'i skal ba ji bzhin /
analyzed: 'dir ni de dang chos mthun pa ni dman pa'i byang chub bo // de ni gnyi ga'i 'bras bu la de'i skal ba ji bzhin /

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i mi slu ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i mi slu ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That is the result of both, and it is the application of the nondeceptive result, according to one‚Äôs fortune.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, ‚Äúagain‚Äù and so on.

original: bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dag dang bcas pa ni sbed pa'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dag dang bcas pa ni sbed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Protection‚Äù and ‚Äúdefense‚Äù are the same as ‚Äúconcealment.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes pa ni chos thams cad la dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni chos thams cad la dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Thus‚Äù means that all phenomena are without reference points.

analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten pa nyid de'i bsrung ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú In dependence on‚Äù means that the perfection of wisdom is the protection of that, through its conformity and divergence.

original: de gzhan la mi brten zhes pa ni gzhan la rag las pa min pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de gzhan la mi brten zhes pa ni gzhan la rag las pa min pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Not dependent on another‚Äù means that the application is not dependent on another.

original: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Nevertheless‚Äù and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mor rnam pa bdun du bsgrags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mor rnam pa bdun du bsgrags pa gsungs te /
translated: The great mother, the Transcendent Conqueror, has declared seven aspects.

original: chos rnams thams cad sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang rmi lam dang / brag ca dang mig yor dang gzugs brnyan dang dri za'i grong khyer bzhin no zhes so //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang rmi lam dang / brag ca dang mig yor dang gzugs brnyan dang dri za'i grong khyer bzhin no zhes so //
translated: ‚Äú All phenomena are like an illusion, a mirage, a dream, an echo, an optical illusion, a reflection, and a city of gandharvas.‚Äù

original: gang yang rnam pa bdun du snang ba de thams cad yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par bshad de /
analyzed: gang yang rnam pa bdun du snang ba de thams cad yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par bshad de /

original: gang zhig chos rnams thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi ngo bo la don dam par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig chos rnams thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi ngo bo la don dam par brjod pa ste /
translated: Someone who says that all phenomena, which are dependently arisen in the sense of ultimately existing by way of their own entities, are ultimately the nature of the conventional

original: de ni dpe gcig gis kyang bstan par nus pa las /
analyzed: de ni dpe gcig gis kyang bstan par nus pa las /

analyzed: gdul bya kha cig la dpe kha @120b cig gang gang grags pa de'i ngo bo dpe mang po gsungs te /
