analyzed: des nye bar mtshon pas bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la brag ca nyid gsungs pa'o //
translated: By means of that illustration, she teaches that this Bhagavatƒ´ is like an echo.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa ni /
translated: The Bhagavatƒ´ teaches from the perspective of the state of meditative equipoise:

original: nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSpace‚Äù and so on.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The Bhagavatƒ´ teaches from the perspective of the state of not being in meditative equipoise:

original: de ji snyam zhes pa la sgos pa ste /
analyzed: de ji snyam zhes pa la sgos pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat do you think?‚Äù

original: yongs su shes par gyur nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par gyur nas zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving fully understood‚Äù and so on.

original: des de'i ci zhig srung bar byed de snang ba rnams la de kho na nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni shes byed rnam bdun gyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: des de'i ci zhig srung bar byed de snang ba rnams la de kho na nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni shes byed rnam bdun gyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: What does it protect? It protects against the appearance of the lack of reality in reality. This is the sevenfold reasoning.

original: sbyor ba mnyam pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: sbyor ba mnyam pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: The fourth, the equality of application, is taught in the treatise:

original: gzugs la sogs pa rlom med pa //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rlom med pa //
translated: Not conceiving of form and so on,

original: rnam bzhi de yi mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: rnam bzhi de yi mnyam pa nyid //
translated: there is the equality of the four.

original: ces te / gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa rnam pa bzhi rlom pa'i sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: ces te / gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa rnam pa bzhi rlom pa'i sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The equality of application is the non-conception of the four types of abiding in form and so on.

original: ji ltar yum chen mo las /
analyzed: ji ltar yum chen mo las /
translated: As it is said in the Great Mother:

original: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: Do not conceive of form.

original: gzugs kyis dang bdag gi gzugs dang / gzugs la dang / de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la gnas nas te /
analyzed: gzugs kyis dang bdag gi gzugs dang / gzugs la dang / de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la gnas nas te /
translated: Do not conceive of form in the self, the self in form, form in feeling, and so on.

original: 'dis nye bar mtshon pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang / rnam par rtog pa brgyad po rnams te /
analyzed: 'dis nye bar mtshon pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang / rnam par rtog pa brgyad po rnams te /
translated: This illustrates the eight conceptions: the four conceptions of the apprehended and the four conceptions of the apprehender.

original: de ltar rtog pa'i sbyor ba ni mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa'i sbyor ba ni mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Such an application of thought is sameness.

original: de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni /
translated: That is stated

original: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: in ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes pa yang gzhung kha cig la'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes pa yang gzhung kha cig la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is in some texts.

original: gang du brag ca lta bu'i chos rnams thams cad la 'dir des dngos po la mngon par zhen pa des rlom sems pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang du brag ca lta bu'i chos rnams thams cad la 'dir des dngos po la mngon par zhen pa des rlom sems pa med pa'o //
translated: Where all phenomena are like an echo, here there is no conceit of that one who is attached to entities.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni blta bar bya ba rnams su'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni blta bar bya ba rnams su'o //
translated: One does not see them as objects of vision.

original: mi shes pa ni 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni 'dzin pas so //
translated: One does not know them through grasping.

original: yang dag par mi shes pa ni brtags pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par mi shes pa ni brtags pas so //
translated: One does not know them correctly through imputation.

original: de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, having stated the four kinds of conceptual thoughts of the apprehended and the four kinds of conceptual thoughts of the apprehender,

original: de dag kyang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes pa ste /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThose, too, etc.‚Äù

original: med cing zhes pa ni sems can gyi rlom pa de brtags na'o //
analyzed: med cing zhes pa ni sems can gyi rlom pa de brtags na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not exist‚Äù is in terms of the conceit of sentient beings.

original: yang dag par mi snang zhes pa ni blta bar bya bar gzung du med la /
analyzed: yang dag par mi snang zhes pa ni blta bar bya bar gzung du med la /
translated: ‚ÄúDo not appear‚Äù is in terms of the apprehended as objects of vision.

original: yang dag par med cing zhes pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems kyis shes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par med cing zhes pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems kyis shes par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot really existing‚Äù means that it is known by the mind in meditative equipoise.

original: mi dmigs zhes pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i nyid kyis rnam par brtag byar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs zhes pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i nyid kyis rnam par brtag byar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot apprehended‚Äù means that it is not to be imagined by the mind not in meditative equipoise.

original: de ltar ni rnam par @121a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni rnam par @121a * //
translated: Thus,

original: rtog pa rnam pa brgyad po des chos thams cad la mi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa rnam pa brgyad po des chos thams cad la mi spyod pa ste /
translated: one does not engage with all phenomena through these eight kinds of conceptualization.

original: de la gal te zhes pa ni sbyor ba mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la gal te zhes pa ni sbyor ba mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means the equality of application.

original: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid kyi zhar la bstan pa mnyam pa nyid kyang 'dir bstan na yang dag par yid ches pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid kyi zhar la bstan pa mnyam pa nyid kyang 'dir bstan na yang dag par yid ches pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In the context of the equality of application, the equality of teaching is also taught here. In order to inspire complete confidence, it is said, ‚ÄúThen, the Blessed One, having known the thoughts of those bodhisattvas‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ni 'di nyid de mi mjed kyi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ni 'di nyid de mi mjed kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis very world system‚Äù is the world system of Endurance.

original: sangs rgyas stong ni gang 'dir mi mjed 'di nyid kyi bskal pa bzang po la sogs par byang chub pa rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas stong ni gang 'dir mi mjed 'di nyid kyi bskal pa bzang po la sogs par byang chub pa rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúA thousand buddhas‚Äù are those who awaken in this very Endurance, in the Fortunate Eon, and so forth.

original: de la thog ma bzhi mngon par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de la thog ma bzhi mngon par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Among them, the first four have already awakened.

original: 'khor ba 'jig dang / gser thub dang / 'od srungs dang / sh'akya thub pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'jig dang / gser thub dang / 'od srungs dang / sh'akya thub pa rnams te /
translated: Krakucchanda, Kanakamuni, KƒÅ≈õyapa, and ≈öƒÅkyamuni.

original: de rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir mnyam par bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir mnyam par bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to teach those, desiring to teach their equality, he said,

original: 'di dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThese‚Äù and so forth.

original: byams bas kyang de'i rjes la stong phrag lnga yang 'di nyid zhes pa ni bstan pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: byams bas kyang de'i rjes la stong phrag lnga yang 'di nyid zhes pa ni bstan pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Maitreya also, after that, said, ‚ÄúFive thousand‚Äù and so forth, which is the equality of the teaching.

original: gtso bor gsungs shing rnam par dag pa'i mngon par brjod pa po'i le'u ni rnam par dag pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: gtso bor gsungs shing rnam par dag pa'i mngon par brjod pa po'i le'u ni rnam par dag pa'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter that is the pure expression of the principal one is the Pure Chapter.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel ba gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba pandi ta chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas pas mdzad pa las le'u brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel ba gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba pandi ta chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas pas mdzad pa las le'u brgyad pa'o /
translated: This was the eighth chapter in the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in eight thousand lines, called A Light on the Meaning.

original: // / bshad ma thag pa'i bstan pa mnyam pa nyid la rnam par slob par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: // / bshad ma thag pa'i bstan pa mnyam pa nyid la rnam par slob par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Desiring to train in the equality of the teaching just explained, he said,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThen‚Äù and so forth.

original: ming tsam zhes pa ni ming gi don te kho na nyid du ni yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ming tsam zhes pa ni ming gi don te kho na nyid du ni yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMere name‚Äù is the object of the name; it is not existent in reality.

original: 'di'o zhes pa ni 'di ltar gong du gong gis gang du dngos po'i ngo bo don dam par yod pa mnyam zhing ming gis brjod pa rnams ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'o zhes pa ni 'di ltar gong du gong gis gang du dngos po'i ngo bo don dam par yod pa mnyam zhing ming gis brjod pa rnams ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the above, where the nature of entities is equal in the ultimate, and those expressed by names are mistaken.

original: de ni dngos po yod par ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni dngos po yod par ma yin la /
translated: That is not existent as an entity.üîΩThose who speak conventionally are like an echo.

original: kun rdzob pa'i brjod pa po rnams ni brag ca lta bu na de lta na ni brjod par bya ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i brjod pa po rnams ni brag ca lta bu na de lta na ni brjod par bya ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: If so, is there an object of expression?

original: de gsungs pa ni yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni yin zhe na /
translated: That is stated.

original: 'dir mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'dir mi dmigs te /
translated: Here, there is no observation.

original: gang du chos gnyis don dam par med de /
analyzed: gang du chos gnyis don dam par med de /
translated: Where the two phenomena do not exist ultimately,

original: de'i phyir nye bar dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: therefore there is no observation.

original: brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi tha snyad ni kun rdzob pa'o zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi tha snyad ni kun rdzob pa'o zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The conventions of the object of expression and the means of expression are conventional.üîΩThus, the nonexistence of the perfection of wisdom is to be established.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yod pa ma yin pa ni bsgrub par bya ba la des na bstan pa mnyam pa nyid la slob par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yod pa ma yin pa ni bsgrub par bya ba la des na bstan pa mnyam pa nyid la slob par byed do //
translated: Therefore, one trains in the equality of the teachings.

original: ci'i slad du zhe na zhes pa ni rgyu gang gis gang du yang med do zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhe na zhes pa ni rgyu gang gis gang du yang med do zhes pa'i don te /
translated: Why? means by what cause? and where? means in what place?

original: yod pa ma yin pas na mngon par byang chub par mi nus zhes pa la @121b dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pas na mngon par byang chub par mi nus zhes pa la @121b dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to manifest complete enlightenment because it does not exist.

original: de ltar yang zhes pa ni 'dir khyod kyis chos rnams stong pa nyid du mthong ba de bzhin du de rnams kyis mngon par byang chub nas bstan par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes pa ni 'dir khyod kyis chos rnams stong pa nyid du mthong ba de bzhin du de rnams kyis mngon par byang chub nas bstan par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus also means that just as you see phenomena as emptiness, so they will manifest complete enlightenment and become the teachings.

original: 'dir mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: Here, in terms of the path of seeing, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
translated: In the truths of suffering and so on,

original: chos shes rjes su shes bzod dang // shes pa'i skad cig bdag nyid 'di //üîΩkun shes tshul las mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: chos shes rjes su shes bzod dang // shes pa'i skad cig bdag nyid 'di // kun shes tshul las mthong ba'i lam //
translated: the nature of Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge and acceptance and knowledgeüîΩmoments is

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: the path of seeing from the perspective of knowing all.

original: chos ni 'dir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la chos kyi yul shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni 'dir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la chos kyi yul shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: Dharma here refers to the absence of intrinsic reality. Knowledge of the object of Dharma is Dharma knowledge.

original: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dag dang bzod pa dang chos shes pa dag dang de las gzhan pa'i skad cig ma rnams kyang de'i bdag nyid can de /
analyzed: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dag dang bzod pa dang chos shes pa dag dang de las gzhan pa'i skad cig ma rnams kyang de'i bdag nyid can de /
translated: Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge, perseverance for Dharma knowledge and perseverance for subsequent knowledge, and other moments are also of that nature.

original: de ni rim gyis bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de ni rim gyis bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise teaches them in order:

original: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
analyzed: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
translated: Form is not permanent and not impermanent.üîΩIt is beyond extremes, pure,üîΩunborn, unceasing, and so on,üîΩlike space, free from attachment,üîΩfree from grasping,

original: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang // ma skyes ma 'gags la sogs dang // mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid kyis brjod med dang // gang phyir 'di don brjod pa yis //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang // ma skyes ma 'gags la sogs dang // mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid kyis brjod med dang // gang phyir 'di don brjod pa yis //
translated: inexpressible by nature,üîΩand not to be given to others.üîΩIt is not to be objectified,

original: gzhan pa sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam dag nad mi 'byung //
analyzed: gzhan pa sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam dag nad mi 'byung //
translated: and it is utterly pure, free from disease.

original: ngan song chad dang 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: ngan song chad dang 'bras bu ni //
translated: It is the severance of lower rebirth and the result

original: mngon du bya la mi rtog nyid //üîΩmtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang ; / dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la //
analyzed: mngon du bya la mi rtog nyid // mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang ; / dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la //
translated: that is nonconceptuality.üîΩIt is not connected with signs,üîΩand it is the nonarising of consciousness

original: shes pa skye ba med pa ni //
analyzed: shes pa skye ba med pa ni //
translated: in things, names, and both.

original: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
analyzed: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
translated: The moment of complete knowledge itself.

original: zhes te / mtha' las 'das zhes pa ni rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes te / mtha' las 'das zhes pa ni rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The beyond is purity.üîΩThe third is the moment of purity, which is the second moment of purity.üîΩ The fourth is the moment of liberation, which is the third moment of purity.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la rnam par dag pas yongs su dag ces pa ni gsum pa'o //üîΩbrjod pa yis zhes pa dang grol ba dang zhes pa rjes su sbyar ba'i gang phyir zhes bya ba ni rung ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la rnam par dag pas yongs su dag ces pa ni gsum pa'o // brjod pa yis zhes pa dang grol ba dang zhes pa rjes su sbyar ba'i gang phyir zhes bya ba ni rung ba'o //
translated: The fifth is the moment of complete knowledge, which is the fourth moment of purity.üîΩ The sixth is the moment of the path of seeing, which is the fifth moment of purity.üîΩ The seventh is the moment of the path of meditation, which is the sixth moment of purity.üîΩ The eighth is the moment of the path of no more learning, which is the seventh moment of purity.

original: de ltar 'di ni thams cad shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni thams cad shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug ste /
translated: The ninth is the moment of the path of seeing, which is the eighth moment of purity.üîΩ The tenth is the moment of the path of meditation, which is the ninth moment of purity.üîΩ The eleventh is the moment of the path of no more learning, which is the tenth moment of purity.

original: de la de ltar yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni skad cig ma gnyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la de ltar yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni skad cig ma gnyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: The twelfth is the moment of the path of seeing, which is the eleventh moment of purity.üîΩ The thirteenth is the moment of the path of meditation, which is the twelfth moment of purity.üîΩ The fourteenth is the moment of the path of no more learning, which is the thirteenth moment of purity.üîΩ The fifteenth is the moment of the path of seeing, which is the fourteenth moment of purity.üîΩ The sixteenth is the moment of the path of meditation, which is the fifteenth moment of purity.üîΩ The seventeenth is the moment of the path of no more learning, which is the sixteenth moment of purity.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rtag pa ma yin bcings pa ma yin grol ba ma yin la rang nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la mi sbyor bas zhes pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rtag pa ma yin bcings pa ma yin grol ba ma yin la rang nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la mi sbyor bas zhes pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The eighteenth is the moment of the path of seeing, which is the seventeenth moment of purity.üîΩ The nineteenth is the moment of the path of meditation, which is the eighteenth moment of purity.üîΩ The twentieth is the moment of the path of no more learning, which is the nineteenth moment of purity.üîΩ The twenty-first is the moment of the path of seeing, which is the twentieth moment of purity.üîΩ The twenty-second is the moment of the path of meditation, which is the twenty-first moment of purity.üîΩ The twenty-third is the moment of the path of no more learning, which is the twenty-second moment of purity.üîΩ The twenty-fourth is the moment of the path of seeing, which is the twenty-

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni shin tu rtag cing dag pa'o zhes pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni shin tu rtag cing dag pa'o zhes pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúForm and so forth are utterly permanent and pure‚Äù is the Dharma knowledge of suffering.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩyongs @122a * //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste / yongs @122a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThus have I heard‚Äù and so forth.

original: su dag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams rnam par dag pas stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: su dag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams rnam par dag pas stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe thoroughly pure forms and so forth are empty of purity and are free from emptiness‚Äù is the subsequent forbearance of the knowledge of suffering.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams rnam par dag pas skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams rnam par dag pas skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe forms and so forth are not produced and do not cease, and they are characterized by the absence of affliction and the absence of purification‚Äù is the subsequent knowledge of suffering.

original: chos rnams thams cad nam mkha' bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa med pas /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad nam mkha' bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa med pas /
translated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena are like space, without production and so forth.

original: nam mkha' la zhes pa la sogs pa ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la zhes pa la sogs pa ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn space‚Äù and so forth is the forbearance of the Dharma knowledge of the origin.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du chos rnams thams cad kyis gos pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni kun 'byung ba'i chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du chos rnams thams cad kyis gos pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni kun 'byung ba'i chos shes pa'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are unstained, like space, the perfection of wisdom is pure. This is the knowledge of the phenomenon of origination.

original: chos rnams nam mkha' ltar yongs su 'dzin pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams nam mkha' ltar yongs su 'dzin pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Since phenomena are ungraspable, like space, the perfection of wisdom is pure. This is the acceptance of subsequent knowledge with regard to origination.

original: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Space, etc.

original: smrar med cing brjod du med pa ni ji ltar nam mkha' la ri bo dang chu dang rlung gi brag cas cung zad brjod du med de /
analyzed: smrar med cing brjod du med pa ni ji ltar nam mkha' la ri bo dang chu dang rlung gi brag cas cung zad brjod du med de /
translated: Since it is inexpressible and indescribable, like space, a mountain, water, or a wind cannot be expressed in the slightest.

original: de bzhin du chos rnams thams cad ces pa ste nam mkha' la brjod du med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rnams thams cad ces pa ste nam mkha' la brjod du med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: Similarly, since all phenomena are inexpressible in space, the perfection of wisdom is pure. This is subsequent knowledge with regard to origination.

original: gang gis brjod pa'i 'dod pa'i don gzhan gyis thob par byed pa dang thob pa po'i brjod pas brjod pa ni ji ltar nam mkha' la brag cas cung zad brjod du med pa de bzhin du chos rnams thams cad nam mkha' ltar brjod du med pas shes rab
analyzed: gang gis brjod pa'i 'dod pa'i don gzhan gyis thob par byed pa dang thob pa po'i brjod pas brjod pa ni ji ltar nam mkha' la brag cas cung zad brjod du med pa de bzhin du chos rnams thams cad nam mkha' ltar brjod du med pas shes rab
translated: Just as an echo in space is not expressible in the slightest, so all phenomena are inexpressible like space.üîΩThis is the completely pure perfection of wisdom.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nye bar dmigs pa med la /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nye bar dmigs pa med la /
translated: This is the acceptance of the knowledge of the Dharmas in relation to cessation.üîΩThat which is not an object is an echo, and that is inexpressible.

original: gang dmigs pa med pa ni brag cas smrar med cing de brjod du med ces pa ni bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: gang dmigs pa med pa ni brag cas smrar med cing de brjod du med ces pa ni bsdus pa ste /
translated: This is the summary.

original: de yang de'i mi dmigs pa ni de'i ngo bo de la de yis te /
analyzed: de yang de'i mi dmigs pa ni de'i ngo bo de la de yis te /
translated: Moreover, its non-apprehension is its nature.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la cung zad dmigs su med pa de ltar chos rnams te /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la cung zad dmigs su med pa de ltar chos rnams te /
translated: Just as space is not apprehended in the slightest, so are phenomena.üîΩHere, it is completely pure because it is not apprehended like space.

original: 'dir nam mkha' bzhin du dmigs su med pas yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir nam mkha' bzhin du dmigs su med pas yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the Dharmas in relation to cessation.

original: thams cad du yang des gos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / gos pa med pa'i rnam par byang ba can gyi chos de rnams kyis ma gos pa ni gos pa med @122b pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad du yang des gos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / gos pa med pa'i rnam par byang ba can gyi chos de rnams kyis ma gos pa ni gos pa med @122b pa nyid do //
translated: And in all ways, the uncontaminated is the non-contamination by those phenomena which are contaminated by the contamination of that, and which are purified by the absence of contamination.

original: gnyi ga yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: And both are pure because they are not apprehended. This is the receptivity to the subsequent knowledge of cessation.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa nas 'chi ba'i dus zhes pa'i bar ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa nas 'chi ba'i dus zhes pa'i bar ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: Having said that, etc., up to the time of death is the subsequent knowledge of cessation.

original: mang po zhes pa la sogs pa nas ji ltar zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i rin po che bsrungs pas kyang ste 'o na 'di nyid rin po che chen po la bsrung ba ste 'di las bsrung ba gzhan rnams kyis ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: mang po zhes pa la sogs pa nas ji ltar zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i rin po che bsrungs pas kyang ste 'o na 'di nyid rin po che chen po la bsrung ba ste 'di las bsrung ba gzhan rnams kyis ci bya zhe na /
translated: The many, etc., up to how is the protection of the unsurpassed jewel. But if it is the protection of the great jewel, what is the use of other protections?

original: gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is said:

original: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Nevertheless, etc.

original: dgra ni bar chad med pa'o //
analyzed: dgra ni bar chad med pa'o //
translated: The enemy is the absence of obstacles.

original: ci tsam du gces par 'gyur ba ni ci tsam du rab tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ci tsam du gces par 'gyur ba ni ci tsam du rab tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The how much is the how much of the best.

original: 'dir bsod nams la bstod pa gsungs pas ngan song la sogs pa chad pa don gyis gsungs pa'o zhes pa ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir bsod nams la bstod pa gsungs pas ngan song la sogs pa chad pa don gyis gsungs pa'o zhes pa ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Here, by the statement of praise of merit, the meaning of the exclusion of the miserable destinies, etc. is stated. This is the receptivity to the knowledge of the teaching with regard to the path.

original: bla na med pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The unsurpassed and so on.

original: zhugs pa ni 'jug pa la 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: zhugs pa ni 'jug pa la 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: The entry is the engagement. The commentary on this is all and so on.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes pa ni rtag pa'i tshul gyis so //üîΩde lta na ni rnam par rtog pa can no zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes pa ni rtag pa'i tshul gyis so // de lta na ni rnam par rtog pa can no zhe na /
translated: The fearless manner is the permanent manner.

original: gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni /
translated: If it is like that, it is conceptual, one might say.

original: skye ba med ces pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩmi zhum pa ni mngon par mi zhen pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med ces pa la sogs pa ste / mi zhum pa ni mngon par mi zhen pa'o //
translated: The statement is unborn and so on.üîΩNon-discouragement is non-attachment.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba ni mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba ni mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Non-defilement is non-abiding.

original: yongs su mi 'dzin pa ni yang dag par mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su mi 'dzin pa ni yang dag par mi shes pa ste /
translated: Non-grasping is non-understanding.

original: rnam pa gsum du yang rtog par mi byed pas de ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes pa ni lam la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du yang rtog par mi byed pas de ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes pa ni lam la chos shes pa'o //
translated: Since one does not conceive even in terms of the three, it is thus non-conceptual. This is the dharma cognition of the path.

original: ma skyes zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The non-arisen, etc.

original: 'bras bu skye ba ma dmigs pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba ma dmigs pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The non-observation of the arising of the effect is non-arisen.

original: de'i rgyus gos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyus gos pa med pa ste /
translated: By that cause, there is no stain,

original: 'bras bu skyed pa'i mtshan ma rnams ni dri ma rnams su gyur pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa'i mtshan ma rnams ni dri ma rnams su gyur pas so //
translated: because the signs of producing the effect become the stains.

original: de ltar na ci'i phyir ma gos she na /
analyzed: de ltar na ci'i phyir ma gos she na /
translated: If it is asked, Why is it not stained?

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i pha rol tu son pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i pha rol tu son pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because the perfection of wisdom has gone beyond conceptualization.

original: ji ltar gos pa med pa nyid na gsungs pa de ni de ltar yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gos pa med pa nyid na gsungs pa de ni de ltar yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said that it is also not stained in the way that is stated, etc.

original: skye bar byed pa'i 'bras bu rnams la yang chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma'i dri ma rnams nub par gyur pas gos pa med pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: skye bar byed pa'i 'bras bu rnams la yang chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma'i dri ma rnams nub par gyur pas gos pa med pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Since the stains of the signs of all phenomena have subsided even in the effects that are produced, there is no stain. This is the receptivity to the subsequent cognition of the path.

original: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If it is asked, But if it is not stained, etc.,

original: de ltar yang zhes pa ni shin tu phra mo'i dngos pa yang yi ge dang mi rnams kyis te /
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes pa ni shin tu phra mo'i dngos pa yang yi ge dang mi rnams kyis te /
translated: Thus, the very subtle entities, the letters and the people,

original: 'dir dngos po @123a * //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po @123a * //
translated: Here, the entities

original: dang / yi ge dang gnyis su snang ba rnams gsum char yang phyin ci log cing med pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang / yi ge dang gnyis su snang ba rnams gsum char yang phyin ci log cing med pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: and the two appearances, letters and so on, are all to be abandoned because they are mistaken and non-existent.

original: phyin ci log gi spros pa de rnams ni med pa nyid pas 'dir de ltar spros par mi byed ces pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'o //üîΩthams cad shes pa nyid 'di rnams la yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas pa nyid la sogs par sbyor bar 'gyur bas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyir 'gyur la de ltar ma gyur pas ni nyan thos la sogs pa
analyzed: phyin ci log gi spros pa de rnams ni med pa nyid pas 'dir de ltar spros par mi byed ces pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'o // thams cad shes pa nyid 'di rnams la yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas pa nyid la sogs par sbyor bar 'gyur bas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyir 'gyur la de ltar ma gyur pas ni nyan thos la sogs pa
translated: Since those conceptual elaborations of error do not exist, one should not elaborate in that way here. This is subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: Since these are also applied to the knowledge of all aspects, such as not dwelling in cyclic existence and nirvana, they become those of the bodhisattvas, and if they are not so applied, they become those of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: chos la bdag med pa la sogs ldog pa'i sgo nas srid pa dang zhi ba la kun tu gnas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i thams cad shes pa nyid ni ji srid sems bskyed pa lnga po'i bar du ste /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la sogs ldog pa'i sgo nas srid pa dang zhi ba la kun tu gnas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i thams cad shes pa nyid ni ji srid sems bskyed pa lnga po'i bar du ste /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the essence of the five kinds of generation of the Thought of Enlightenment, from the first to the fifth, in the sense of abiding in existence and peace, etc., by way of the reversal of the selflessness of dharmas, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'bring po las de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'bring po las de gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is stated in the medium length Mother:

original: thams cad shes pa'i ye shes kyis mthong nas kyang mthong ba las shin tu 'da' bar 'dod pa dang / lam shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes te /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa'i ye shes kyis mthong nas kyang mthong ba las shin tu 'da' bar 'dod pa dang / lam shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes te /
translated: The Bodhisattva who, having seen with the knowledge of all aspects, wishes to transcend seeing, and wishes to perfect the knowledge of the path.

original: de la ye shes ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi mngon par rtogs pa la /
analyzed: de la ye shes ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi mngon par rtogs pa la /
translated: Therein, knowledge is the clear realization of the Bodhisattva's path of seeing.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam nyid la nyan thos la sogs pa'i rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam nyid la nyan thos la sogs pa'i rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The Bodhisattva's path of seeing itself perfects the realization of the Sravakas, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa rnam par bcad pas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa rnam par bcad pas mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seeing by way of the elimination of inference.

original: ye shes kyis mthong ba'i tshig ni 'khrul pa gcod pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyis mthong ba'i tshig ni 'khrul pa gcod pa ste /
translated: The phrase seeing with knowledge eliminates error.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis rnams bsgom lam du med par shes pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis rnams bsgom lam du med par shes pa'i don du'o //
translated: The path of meditation of bodhisattvas is for the purpose of knowing that the paths of meditation of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas do not exist.

original: shin tu 'das nas yang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la zhugs pa'o zhes 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes bshad la /
analyzed: shin tu 'das nas yang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la zhugs pa'o zhes 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes bshad la /
translated: Arya Vimuktisena explains that having passed completely beyond, one enters complete realization of all aspects.

original: de'i phyir na bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir na bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:üîΩThe sravaka and so on see the truth

original: nyan thos la sogs mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The path of seeing of the sravakas and so onüîΩ

original: zhes te 'di nyid kyis na sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa'i 'grel pa las thams cad shes pa nyid sa bdun par rnam par gzhag pa'i seng ge bzang po'i bshad pa ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhes te 'di nyid kyis na sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa'i 'grel pa las thams cad shes pa nyid sa bdun par rnam par gzhag pa'i seng ge bzang po'i bshad pa ni mi 'thad do //
translated: This itself explains that the explanation of Haribhadra that the knowledge of all aspects is posited on the seventh level in the commentary on the Verses Summarizing the Transcendences is untenable.

original: gzhan yang de'i mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / bdag cag gi dag ni mkhas pa rnams kyi rigs pas so sor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / bdag cag gi dag ni mkhas pa rnams kyi rigs pas so sor brtag par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the distinctions of their realization and so on should be analyzed by the learned through reasoning.

original: cung zhig bdag cag gis ni mi bden par @123b mthong nas spang byar bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: cung zhig bdag cag gis ni mi bden par @123b mthong nas spang byar bri bar bya'o //
translated: We see that it is not true, and so we should reject it.

original: gzhan gyi don du ji ltar mthong ba nyid kyi don yang nas yang du mngon du byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsgom pa'i lam mo zhas nye bar bstan pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du ji ltar mthong ba nyid kyi don yang nas yang du mngon du byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsgom pa'i lam mo zhas nye bar bstan pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The path of cultivation for bodhisattvas is to make manifest again and again the meaning that is seen for the sake of others.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i mdo sde yang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i mdo sde yang /
translated: The noble S≈´tra on the Ten Stages also explains:

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rnams kyis rab tu dga' bar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi mthong ba las shin tu 'das pas bsgom pa ni ma yin no zhes pa dang yang bshad de /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rnams kyis rab tu dga' bar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi mthong ba las shin tu 'das pas bsgom pa ni ma yin no zhes pa dang yang bshad de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cultivation of those who have given rise to the thought of awakening and so on is not the cultivation of the hearers and solitary buddhas, because it is beyond their path of seeing.‚Äù

original: sems bskyed pa lnga pa las byang chub sems dpa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'das par gyur te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa lnga pa las byang chub sems dpa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'das par gyur te /
translated: And in the fifth generation of the thought of awakening, it says: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva has gone beyond the stage of all foolish ordinary beings and the stage of the hearers and solitary buddhas.‚Äù

original: kun tu 'das par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa dang / ring du song ba la ni byang chub sems dpa' rang gi yum gyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid chen po la gnas pa'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bya ba las shin tu 'da' bar 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun tu 'das par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa dang / ring du song ba la ni byang chub sems dpa' rang gi yum gyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid chen po la gnas pa'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bya ba las shin tu 'da' bar 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: And on the Gone Afar, it is said that the bodhisattva, by abiding in the great nature of his mother, the gnosis, transcends the activities of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de'i phyir na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i shes pa yang yod ces par shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i shes pa yang yod ces par shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas also have the knowledge that all phenomena are natureless.

original: de yod pa ma yin na phyi rol pa bzhin du khams gsum pa'i mngon du rgyu ba dang bag la nyal 'di rnams spong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin na phyi rol pa bzhin du khams gsum pa'i mngon du rgyu ba dang bag la nyal 'di rnams spong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they did not have that, like the non-Buddhists, they would not eliminate the manifest and the latent afflictions of the three realms,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du dmigs pas phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du dmigs pas phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would be mistaken, observing form and so on as having an essence.

original: chos thams cad la ngo bo nyid med par yongs su shes par yongs su rdzogs pa'i chos la bdag med bsgom pa ni med la khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu spong ba'i thabs tsam yod pa nyid dang / gang zag gi bdag med pa ma lus par bsgom pa la de rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go zhes pa ni slob dpon zla ba'i grags pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bzhed pa gang zag la bdag med
analyzed: chos thams cad la ngo bo nyid med par yongs su shes par yongs su rdzogs pa'i chos la bdag med bsgom pa ni med la khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu spong ba'i thabs tsam yod pa nyid dang / gang zag gi bdag med pa ma lus par bsgom pa la de rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go zhes pa ni slob dpon zla ba'i grags pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bzhed pa gang zag la bdag med
translated: The assertion of others is that the perfection of wisdom and so on are posited for those who meditate on the selflessness of persons but not on the selflessness of phenomena, for those who meditate on the selflessness of phenomena but not on the selflessness of persons, and for those who meditate on both.üîΩThe assertion of others is that the perfection of wisdom and so on are posited for those who meditate on the selflessness of persons but not on the selflessness of phenomena, for those who meditate on the selflessness of phenomena but not on the selflessness of persons, and for those who meditate on both.

original: pa'i shes pa nyid ni yod pa la chos la bdag med pa'i shes pa ni med de skad cig mas bdag med par shes pas kyang ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur zhes pa ni gzhan dag gi'o //üîΩde ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang// yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
analyzed: pa'i shes pa nyid ni yod pa la chos la bdag med pa'i shes pa ni med de skad cig mas bdag med par shes pas kyang ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur zhes pa ni gzhan dag gi'o //üîΩde ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang// yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
translated: The assertion of others is that the perfection of wisdom and so on are posited for those who meditate on the selflessness of persons but not on the selflessness of phenomena, for those who meditate on the selflessness of phenomena but not on the selflessness of persons, and for those who meditate on both.üîΩThe assertion of others is that the perfection of wisdom and so on are posited for those who meditate on the selflessness of persons but not on the selflessness of phenomena, for those who meditate on the selflessness of phenomena but not on the selflessness of persons, and for those who meditate on both.

original: 'dir ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs @124a * //üîΩsu bstan pa yin //
analyzed: 'dir ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs @124a * // su bstan pa yin //
translated: in their entirety.

original: zhes bstan bcos las te /
analyzed: zhes bstan bcos las te /
translated: This is taught in the treatise.

original: 'dir mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum nya bar bsdus ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum nya bar bsdus ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúagain‚Äù and so forth is made in order to include the three kinds of knowledge in their entirety.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la /
translated: The perfection of wisdom refers to the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of all things.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni sngon du mdor bstan pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni sngon du mdor bstan pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes pa la sogs pas so //

analyzed: 'di dang zhes pa ni gong gi de'i rgyas par bshad pas te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the above extensive explanation.

original: le'u gcig dang / le'u phyed dang bdun dang / le'u phyed dang gnyis pa dag gis go rims ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: le'u gcig dang / le'u phyed dang bdun dang / le'u phyed dang gnyis pa dag gis go rims ji lta ba bzhin du'o //

original: chos gang la yang med ces pa ni de'i sems kyi sbyor bas so //
analyzed: chos gang la yang med ces pa ni de'i sems kyi sbyor bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn any dharma‚Äù refers to the application of that mind.

analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ni dmigs pa la nye bar gzhag par byed pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúEngaging‚Äù means establishing the object.

original: yang dag par ston par byed pa ni mngon sum du byed pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par ston par byed pa ni mngon sum du byed pas so //
translated: It is the correct teaching because it is the direct realization of the truth.

original: nges par ston par byed pa ni yon tan khyad par rnams so //
analyzed: nges par ston par byed pa ni yon tan khyad par rnams so //
translated: The special qualities are the definitive teaching.

original: yongs su thob par byed pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos kyis 'phen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su thob par byed pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos kyis 'phen par byed pa'o //
translated: That which causes attainment is the dharma that is projected by the result.üîΩ

original: nges par 'thob par byed pa ni de nyid mthar phyin pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: nges par 'thob par byed pa ni de nyid mthar phyin pa'i tshul can no //
translated: The one who definitely causes attainment is the one who has the method of perfecting that.üîΩ

original: med ces pa ni thams cad du de thams cad gang du chos thams cad la dmigs pa med pas so //
analyzed: med ces pa ni thams cad du de thams cad gang du chos thams cad la dmigs pa med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNonexistent‚Äù means that all things are nonexistent, since all things are not observed anywhere.

original: 'dir bstan pa thos nas lha rnams kyis ji ltar byas pa de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir bstan pa thos nas lha rnams kyis ji ltar byas pa de gsungs pa ni /
translated: The text explains how the gods acted after hearing this teaching.üîΩ

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The line then and so forth.üîΩ

original: skye bo'i tshogs chen po'i dga' ba skyes nas ku cho dang ga zha dag byed de /
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs chen po'i dga' ba skyes nas ku cho dang ga zha dag byed de /
translated: A great crowd of people were delighted and made a great clamor.üîΩ

original: nyid kyis 'thor zhing gtor nas bstod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid kyis 'thor zhing gtor nas bstod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he himself scatters and hurls them, and praises them.üîΩ

original: 'di chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ma yin zhes pa ni gnyi ga dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ma yin zhes pa ni gnyi ga dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not the setting in motion of the wheel of Dharma, because both are non-apprehensible.

original: gang la yang zhes pa ni chos kyi 'khor las gzhan du yang mi chags shing ma chags pas dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: gang la yang zhes pa ni chos kyi 'khor las gzhan du yang mi chags shing ma chags pas dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir la /
translated: Nor does it settle anywhere else, i.e. in anything other than the wheel of Dharma, because it is unattached and free from objective supports.

original: gang dmigs par 'gyur ba ni gang du mngon par byang chub par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gang dmigs par 'gyur ba ni gang du mngon par byang chub par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: And where it would be apprehended, there it would not be fully enlightened.

original: gang zhig ma smos pa de yod pa ma yin pas gang la yang dag par bstan par 'gyur ba'i rnam par byang ba can gyi chos cung zhig yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ma smos pa de yod pa ma yin pas gang la yang dag par bstan par 'gyur ba'i rnam par byang ba can gyi chos cung zhig yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And what is not mentioned does not exist. Thus, there is not even the slightest phenomenon that has purification and would be indicated anywhere.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ni ma skyes pas so //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ni ma skyes pas so //
translated: Since it is not fully established, it is not produced.

original: chos ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi la /
analyzed: chos ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi la /
translated: A phenomenon is defiled.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams ni rnam @124b par byang ba rnams su brjod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams ni rnam @124b par byang ba rnams su brjod do //
translated: The concentrations on emptiness, etc. are said to be purifications.

original: bstan pa zhes pa ni don dam par bstan pas so //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes pa ni don dam par bstan pas so //
translated: Indication is by ultimate indication.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas su byas pa med pa ni gang zag med pas zhes pa la dgongs pas so zhes pa ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs rdzogs pa'o /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas su byas pa med pa ni gang zag med pas zhes pa la dgongs pas so zhes pa ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs rdzogs pa'o /
translated: This completes the section on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: // / kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bshad nas /
analyzed: // / kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the three types of omniscience,

original: sbyor ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: I will now discuss their cultivation.

original: de ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the knowledge of all aspects is the complete realization of all aspects.

original: de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can de /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can de /
translated: It has the nature of twenty-two types of generation of the knowledge of the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de'i mtha'i sems bskyed pa gnyis ni srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam zhing ro gcig pa'i zhing dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i bdag nyid can ni sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi slob pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha'i sems bskyed pa gnyis ni srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam zhing ro gcig pa'i zhing dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i bdag nyid can ni sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi slob pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The last two of those generations of the knowledge of the aspects are the fruit of no more learning on the level of buddhahood, which has the nature of skill in means in the field of pure equality and single taste of existence and peace.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes /
translated: Thus, ƒÄrya Vimuktisena explains in his commentary on the Twenty-Five Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom S≈´tra:

original: srid dang zhi pa mnyam nyid dang // zhes pa'i 'grel par bshad de /
analyzed: srid dang zhi pa mnyam nyid dang // zhes pa'i 'grel par bshad de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe equality of existence and peace‚Äù is explained in the commentary.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa na bden pa mi slob par 'gyur zhes pa dang mdo sde dgongs pa nges par 'grel par yang nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa phra ba spangs pas shes bya thams cad la thogs pa dang chags pa med par rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pas bsdus pa ni sa bcu gcig pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sar brjod ces gsungs pas na ;
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa na bden pa mi slob par 'gyur zhes pa dang mdo sde dgongs pa nges par 'grel par yang nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa phra ba spangs pas shes bya thams cad la thogs pa dang chags pa med par rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pas bsdus pa ni sa bcu gcig pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sar brjod ces gsungs pas na ;
translated: The Sa·πÉdhinirmocana S≈´tra says that the elimination of the subtle afflictive obstructions and the elimination of the subtle obstructions to omniscience are subsumed under the eleventh bh≈´mi, the buddha bh≈´mi, because it is the complete and perfect realization of all objects of knowledge without obstruction or attachment.

original: seng ge bzang po'i khyad par gyi lam la rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: seng ge bzang po'i khyad par gyi lam la rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to posit the complete and perfect realization of all aspects on the special path of the excellent lion as the eleventh bh≈´mi.

original: de ltar 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes mtshan med par rab tu sbyin la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel par sems bskyed pa dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes mtshan med par rab tu sbyin la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel par sems bskyed pa dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: Thus ƒÄrya Vimuktisena, in his commentary on the Verses on the Perfection of Wisdom in a Hundred Thousand Stanzas, says that from the first generation of bodhicitta

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang ma bral bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing mtshan mar ni mi byed do zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ma bris shing gzhan yang rang nyid kyis dad pa la sogs pa'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun la 'jug gi / dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang por brjod par bya ba ni med do /üîΩdbang po'i don med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pas ni drod la sogs pa dbang po 'di rnams nyid 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa la dgongs pa'i phyir te khyad par gyi lam la dbang po 'di rnams med pa nyid na chos kyi sku'i dbang po yang med par thal
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang ma bral bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing mtshan mar ni mi byed do zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ma bris shing gzhan yang rang nyid kyis dad pa la sogs pa'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun la 'jug gi / dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang por brjod par bya ba ni med do / dbang po'i don med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pas ni drod la sogs pa dbang po 'di rnams nyid 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa la dgongs pa'i phyir te khyad par gyi lam la dbang po 'di rnams med pa nyid na chos kyi sku'i dbang po yang med par thal
translated: One should not say that faith and so on are faculties.üîΩBecause the meaning of faculty would not exist.üîΩThis is stated because it is intended that these faculties such as heat and so on will arise.

original: bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If these faculties do not exist on the special path, it would follow that the faculties of the dharmakƒÅya would not exist.

original: snga ma'i bye brag rtogs nas 'dir phyi ma la rjes su 'jug @125a * //
analyzed: snga ma'i bye brag rtogs nas 'dir phyi ma la rjes su 'jug @125a * //
translated: Having realized the distinctions of the former, one engages in the latter here.

original: ces pa rigs la /
analyzed: ces pa rigs la /
translated: This is logical.

original: de'i yang thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin thams cad kyang dang po'i nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i yang thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin thams cad kyang dang po'i nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: Also, all the natures of hearing and contemplation are to be known at the outset because they are the cause for engaging the teaching.

original: bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro zhes bshad la /
analyzed: bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro zhes bshad la /
translated: Also, the explanation of the signs of irreversibility states:

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags bshad pa yang sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma rjes su shes pa dang 'brel bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung bar srid bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags bshad pa yang sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma rjes su shes pa dang 'brel bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung bar srid bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is possible that those who possess the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering and are connected to subsequent knowledge will fall to the level of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: de ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po 'byin pa po'i phyir ro zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: de ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po 'byin pa po'i phyir ro zhes gsungs la /
translated: Because that is the antidote that abandons the three realms.

original: 'di yang ltung ba 'di rtogs pa ni ji ltar khyad par gyi lam la gnas pa'i mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa la gnas pa nas gzhan pa rnams su srid par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di yang ltung ba 'di rtogs pa ni ji ltar khyad par gyi lam la gnas pa'i mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa la gnas pa nas gzhan pa rnams su srid par 'gyur /
translated: Also, how could one who realizes this downfall, who is abiding on the special path, abide in the effortless state of signlessness?

original: gang zhig byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'og ma la gnas pa de'i yang dag par kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa la tshad med pa rnams dgos te de la las gzhan du na dgu pa la 'gog par ltung zhes bshad cing /
analyzed: gang zhig byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'og ma la gnas pa de'i yang dag par kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa la tshad med pa rnams dgos te de la las gzhan du na dgu pa la 'gog par ltung zhes bshad cing /
translated: For one who is on the lower bodhisattva stages, the four immeasurables are necessary for subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin. Otherwise, it is explained that one would fall to cessation on the ninth stage.

original: gang yang slob dpon dpa' bos kyang ring du song ba la yid kyis yongs su log pa kun tu srid ces bshad la /
analyzed: gang yang slob dpon dpa' bos kyang ring du song ba la yid kyis yongs su log pa kun tu srid ces bshad la /
translated: Also, the master ƒÄrya≈õ≈´ra explains that on the Gone Afar stage, mental reversal is possible.

original: sa mi g-yo ba la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar dgongs zhes pa dang / bstan par 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes bshad do //
analyzed: sa mi g-yo ba la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar dgongs zhes pa dang / bstan par 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes bshad do //
translated: And he explains that on the Immovable stage, one intends to attain complete nirvana, and the noble Vimuktasena explains that on the Cloud of Dharma stage, one attains complete nirvana.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i rtogs pa'i gnas skabs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir snying rje chen po byed ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i rtogs pa'i gnas skabs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir snying rje chen po byed ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus, because one does not attain nirvana on the stage of right investigation, it is said that one practices great compassion.

original: de la 'gog pa dang yongs su ldog pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ltung ba ni dus de srid du sems can gyi don mi 'byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: de la 'gog pa dang yongs su ldog pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ltung ba ni dus de srid du sems can gyi don mi 'byung ba nyid de /
translated: Here, falling to cessation, reversal, and complete nirvana is the nonoccurrence of the benefit of sentient beings for that period of time.

original: de ltar yang sa bcu par de nyid kyis 'dir mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang sa bcu par de nyid kyis 'dir mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: If he were to attain nirvana here,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: he would interrupt the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: gang du bsgom pa'i lam rab kyi bye brag gis sa bcu pa can gyi 'dod pa'i khams kyi tha ma 'chad par 'gyur ba dang bcas pa zhes pa'i khyad par gyi lam dus rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du bsgom pa'i lam rab kyi bye brag gis sa bcu pa can gyi 'dod pa'i khams kyi tha ma 'chad par 'gyur ba dang bcas pa zhes pa'i khyad par gyi lam dus rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The path of meditation is not complete realization of all aspects on the special path of the tenth level, since it is the final stage of the desire realm, as will be explained.

original: de ni sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis la rnam par gnas pa yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis la rnam par gnas pa yin zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that the path of meditation is the twenty second generation of bodhicitta.

original: de'i mdor bstan pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i mdor bstan pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: rnam par sbyor ba bcas rnams dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
analyzed: rnam par sbyor ba bcas rnams dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
translated: Those with preparation, those with qualities, those with faults,üîΩthose with liberation, those with factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: those in training, those in the irreversible assembly,

original: srid dang @125b zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhi dag bla na med pa ni //
analyzed: srid dang @125b zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhi dag bla na med pa ni //
translated: those who equalize existence and peace, those who pacify, those unsurpassed.

original: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste //
translated: The realization of the complete perfection of all aspects,

original: 'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin //
translated: This is together with the skillful means.

original: zhes te / dngos po bcu gcig gis so //
analyzed: zhes te / dngos po bcu gcig gis so //

original: de la rnam pa'i bshad pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la rnam pa'i bshad pa ni bstan bcos las /

original: gzhi shes pa yi bye brag rnams //
analyzed: gzhi shes pa yi bye brag rnams //
translated: The different aspects of the knowledge of the basis

original: rnam pa zhes bya'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: Are defined as the aspects.

original: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //
translated: Because of the three omnisciences,

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: They are asserted as the three aspects.

original: ces te / gzhi la dmigs pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces te / gzhi la dmigs pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa la /
translated: The different aspects of the knowledge of the basis are the four truths and so forth.

original: de'i shes pa de'i bye brag rnams te /
analyzed: de'i shes pa de'i bye brag rnams te /
translated: The different aspects of the knowledge of that areüîΩThe aspects of those who completely know that.

original: gang gis de yongs su shes pa de rnams kyi rnam pa zhes pa ni mtshan nyid kyi ming la /
analyzed: gang gis de yongs su shes pa de rnams kyi rnam pa zhes pa ni mtshan nyid kyi ming la /
translated: The definition of that is
